commit_message:
Revert "msgpack-python has been renamed to msgpack"

This reverts commit af266d1762db074fd283b3d1977d93f3406bdbf3.

As documented in [1] 0.4.6 is the latest official release of the library and I encountered issues with the previews [2]. 

[1] https://github.com/msgpack/msgpack-python/releases
[2] https://www.irccloud.com/pastebin/GnWaKxMD/

Change-Id: I9848738bc6dc69b0e610c6688cc8f2437e5c2f15

commit_message:
Make OpenStackCloud a subclass of Connection

The shade code lives in openstacksdk now and is a part of Connection.
Start making shade a subclass of that for backwards compat.

Mostly only deal with the constructor for now, but go ahead and do
list_flavors and get_flavor_by_id while we're looking at the extra
config override. Also remove list_projects because of its use of the
_normalize module.

keystoneauth lower-constraint needs to be bumped because of
status_code_retries.

Change-Id: Ibbe6e167d6285b30a9adbd0c5a89bc679c5645f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 11:26:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a newly introduced UUID warning in the unit test

We again have places in our test where an UUID field is initialized to
a non UUID value. This patch fixes the remaning places. A subsequent
patch will force the UUID warning in our tests to error to ensure
no new violations are introduced.

Change-Id: I7f66e85453d72b35822ceb84d5dbd25324755476
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a newly introduced UUID warning in the unit test

We again have places in our test where an UUID field is initialized to
a non UUID value. This patch fixes the remaning places. A subsequent
patch will force the UUID warning in our tests to error to ensure
no new violations are introduced.

Change-Id: I7f66e85453d72b35822ceb84d5dbd25324755476

commit_message:
Fix the display of updated_at time when using memcache driver.

When using mc driver(set servicegroup_driver=mc), the service reports
state by memcache. but we use 'nova service-list' get the status of
services registered in nova, the 'update_at' time is not the last updated
time not as db driver. so we should get the time in memcache to update the
time in response.
Closes-Bug: #1647269

Change-Id: I1d4763436ad6de2483c39f5fe97fa6e8d283d8a3

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ha-utils as a requirement

This commit adds the tripleo-ha-utils OpenStack project [1] as a
requirement for the tripleo-quickstart execution. This change will make
us able to test HA bits in upstream deployments.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ha-utils

Change-Id: I860f257d7b8fcaf7b935575eab22d211f4da39b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-25 14:14:01.000000000', 'message': 'Removes vm.swappiness and vfs_cache_pressure

They were both set at 1 in the same commit without justification
and both can be bad things to set that low.  This commit will
just let the kernel defaults come through.

Change-Id: I94186f3e16f61223e362d3db0ddce799ae6120cb
Closes-Bug: 1770171
Signed-off-by: Bryan Quigley <bryan.quigley@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-07-05 17:42:38.000000000', 'message': 'Removes vm.swappiness and vfs_cache_pressure

They were both set at 1 in the same commit without justification
and both can be bad things to set that low.  This commit will
just let the kernel defaults come through.

Details on how bad it is set to these to 1 courtesy of Jay Vosburgh.

vfs_cache_pressure
Setting vfs_cache_pressure to 1 for all cases is likely to cause
excessive memory usage in the dentry and inode caches for most
workloads. For most uses, the default value of 100 is reasonable.

The vfs_cache_pressure value specifies the percentage of objects
in each of the "dentry" and "inode_entry" slab caches used by
filesystems that will be viewed as "freeable" by the slab shrinking
logic. Some other variables also adjust the actual number of objects
that the kernel will try to free, but for the freeable quantity,
a vfs_cache_pressure of 100 will attempt to free 100 times as many
objects in a cache as a setting of 1. Similarly, a vfs_cache_pressure
of 200 will attempt to free twice as many as a setting of 100.

This only comes into play when the kernel has entered reclaim,
i.e., it is trying to free cached objects in order to make space to
satisfy an allocation that would otherwise fail (or an allocation
has already failed or watermarks have been reached and this is
occurring asynchronously). By setting vfs_cache_pressure to 1,
the kernel will disproportionately reclaim pages from the page
cache instead of from the dentry/inode caches, and those will
grow with almost no bound (if vfs_cache_pressure is 0, they will
literally grow without bound until memory is exhausted).

If the system as a whole has a low cache hit ratio on the objects
in the dentry and inode caches, they will simply consume memory
that is kept idle, and force out page cache pages (file data,
block data and anonymous pages). Eventually, the system will resort
to swapping of pages and if all else fails to killing processes to
free memory. With very low vfs_cache_pressure values, it is more
likely that processes will be killed to free memory before
dentry / inode cache objects are released.

We have had several customers alleviate problems be setting
thus value back to the defaults - or having to make them
higher to clean things up after being at 1 for so long.

vm.swappiness
Setting this to 1 will heavily favor (ratio 1:199) releasing file
backed pages over writing anonymous pages to swap ("swapping" a
file backed page just frees the page, as it can be re-read from
its backing file). So, this would, e.g., favor keeping almost all
process anonymous pages (stack, heap, etc), even for idle processes,
in memory over keeping file backed pages in the page cache.

Change-Id: I94186f3e16f61223e362d3db0ddce799ae6120cb
Closes-Bug: 1770171
Signed-off-by: Bryan Quigley <bryan.quigley@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-07-05 18:07:57.000000000', 'message': 'Removes vm.swappiness and vfs_cache_pressure

and both can be bad things to set that low.  This commit will

Details on how bad it is set to these to 1 courtesy of Jay Vosburgh.

vfs_cache_pressure
Setting vfs_cache_pressure to 1 for all cases is likely to cause
excessive memory usage in the dentry and inode caches for most
workloads. For most uses, the default value of 100 is reasonable.

The vfs_cache_pressure value specifies the percentage of objects
in each of the "dentry" and "inode_entry" slab caches used by

a vfs_cache_pressure of 100 will attempt to free 100 times as many
objects in a cache as a setting of 1. Similarly, a vfs_cache_pressure
of 200 will attempt to free twice as many as a setting of 100.

This only comes into play when the kernel has entered reclaim,
i.e., it is trying to free cached objects in order to make space to
satisfy an allocation that would otherwise fail (or an allocation

the kernel will disproportionately reclaim pages from the page

grow with almost no bound (if vfs_cache_pressure is 0, they will
literally grow without bound until memory is exhausted).

If the system as a whole has a low cache hit ratio on the objects
in the dentry and inode caches, they will simply consume memory
that is kept idle, and force out page cache pages (file data,
block data and anonymous pages). Eventually, the system will resort
to swapping of pages and if all else fails to killing processes to

likely that processes will be killed to free memory before
dentry / inode cache objects are released.

We have had several customers alleviate problems be setting
thus value back to the defaults - or having to make them
higher to clean things up after being at 1 for so long.

vm.swappiness
Setting this to 1 will heavily favor (ratio 1:199) releasing file
backed pages over writing anonymous pages to swap ("swapping" a
file backed page just frees the page, as it can be re-read from
its backing file). So, this would, e.g., favor keeping almost all
process anonymous pages (stack, heap, etc), even for idle processes,
in memory over keeping file backed pages in the page cache.

Change-Id: I94186f3e16f61223e362d3db0ddce799ae6120cb
Closes-Bug: 1770171
Signed-off-by: Bryan Quigley <bryan.quigley@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Removes vm.swappiness and vfs_cache_pressure

They were both set at 1 in the same commit without justification
and both can be bad things to set that low.  This commit will
just let the kernel defaults come through.

Details on how bad it is set to these to 1 courtesy of Jay Vosburgh.

vfs_cache_pressure
Setting vfs_cache_pressure to 1 for all cases is likely to cause
excessive memory usage in the dentry and inode caches for most
workloads. For most uses, the default value of 100 is reasonable.

The vfs_cache_pressure value specifies the percentage of objects
in each of the "dentry" and "inode_entry" slab caches used by
filesystems that will be viewed as "freeable" by the slab shrinking
logic. Some other variables also adjust the actual number of objects
that the kernel will try to free, but for the freeable quantity,
a vfs_cache_pressure of 100 will attempt to free 100 times as many
objects in a cache as a setting of 1. Similarly, a vfs_cache_pressure
of 200 will attempt to free twice as many as a setting of 100.

This only comes into play when the kernel has entered reclaim,
i.e., it is trying to free cached objects in order to make space to
satisfy an allocation that would otherwise fail (or an allocation
has already failed or watermarks have been reached and this is
occurring asynchronously). By setting vfs_cache_pressure to 1,
the kernel will disproportionately reclaim pages from the page
cache instead of from the dentry/inode caches, and those will
grow with almost no bound (if vfs_cache_pressure is 0, they will
literally grow without bound until memory is exhausted).

If the system as a whole has a low cache hit ratio on the objects
in the dentry and inode caches, they will simply consume memory
that is kept idle, and force out page cache pages (file data,
block data and anonymous pages). Eventually, the system will resort
to swapping of pages and if all else fails to killing processes to
free memory. With very low vfs_cache_pressure values, it is more
likely that processes will be killed to free memory before
dentry / inode cache objects are released.

We have had several customers alleviate problems be setting
thus value back to the defaults - or having to make them
higher to clean things up after being at 1 for so long.

vm.swappiness
Setting this to 1 will heavily favor (ratio 1:199) releasing file
backed pages over writing anonymous pages to swap ("swapping" a
file backed page just frees the page, as it can be re-read from
its backing file). So, this would, e.g., favor keeping almost all
process anonymous pages (stack, heap, etc), even for idle processes,
in memory over keeping file backed pages in the page cache.

Change-Id: I94186f3e16f61223e362d3db0ddce799ae6120cb
Closes-Bug: 1770171
Signed-off-by: Bryan Quigley <bryan.quigley@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Plumb additional_user_agent and collect_timings support throughout

python-openstackclient currently makes its own Sessions and it sets
additional_user_agent on them itself. For most applications, just
setting app_name and app_version is what they need. But osc-lib wants to
be able to set additional_user_agent - and then osc wants to set
app_name and app_version.

osc-lib also wants timings collected. This is
off by default because in a long-running process if a consumer isn't
expecting this and doesn't reset the timings on a regular basis, the
collected timings can grow infinitely. Add options for this as well.

Change-Id: I9419407a31995674a4ca6dea6f3f6a99d28878ff

commit_message:
fix cellv2 delete_host

When trying to delete host that can be found in host_mappings
but not in compute_nodes, current cellv2 delete_host will throw
an exception but does not really handle it.

This patch tries to handle this exception and allow the delete
operation to continue since it shows the host has gone anyway.

Change-Id: I99bd79fb45777edc0e33d846ba478b0a94a1191e
Closes-Bug: #1781391

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 11:30:53.000000000', 'message': 'ignore devices that have already been processed

Similar to how osdize in charms.ceph checks for already processed
devices we need to avoid checking if they are pristine or not.

Additionally, mapped LUKS devices need to be filtered from being zapped
as they may hold valuable data. They are only used as underlying devices
for device mapper and dmcrypt to provide a decrypted block device
abstration so if they really need to be zapped a mapping needs to be
removed first.

This change also pulls charms.ceph modifications.

Change-Id: I96b3d40b3f9e56681be142377e454b15f9e22be3
Co-Authored-By: Dmitrii Shcherbakov <dmitrii.shcherbakov@canonical.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chris Procter <chris.procter@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: 1781453
'}]
commit_message:
ignore devices that have already been processed

Similar to how osdize in charms.ceph checks for already processed
devices we need to avoid checking if they are pristine or not.

Additionally, mapped LUKS devices need to be filtered from being zapped
as they may hold valuable data. They are only used as underlying devices
for device mapper and dmcrypt to provide a decrypted block device
abstration so if they really need to be zapped a mapping needs to be
removed first.

This change also pulls charms.ceph modifications.

Change-Id: I96b3d40b3f9e56681be142377e454b15f9e22be3
Co-Authored-By: Dmitrii Shcherbakov <dmitrii.shcherbakov@canonical.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chris Procter <chris.procter@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: 1781453

commit_message:
[dashboard] Remove old buttons to create/delete associations

Changes 553444 and 536899 adds new buttons and
tabs to create and delete network and router
associations.

The old way to handle the associations is
not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I856b2b5e8025fe685da78882a5c3822f88796017

messages:
[{'account_id': 28510, 'date': '2018-06-25 06:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28510, 'date': '2018-06-25 06:53:28.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1773910'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-06-25 07:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Two questions:
What is the reason for setting/changing service, and what effect will this have on existing deployments?  Will requests be re-run after a upgrade of the charm?

How/when is the cached requests pruned? It might be I am missing something, but would not storing them forever at some point get us into trouble?'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-06-25 09:24:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I have one request here; right now if we change default key permissions (as we recently had todo), reprocessing of existing broker requests means key perms get updated and I'd be -1 on removing the ability todo that later - so maybe we could have a 'force_update' option on the hook handler so that if we call it from an upgrade-charm or config-changed hook we can override the caching behaviour?"}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2018-06-25 12:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2018-06-25 12:50:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2018-06-25 13:01:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Plz ignore my charm-rechecks.  Was t-shooting our third-party-ci trigger.  Thanks! :-)'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2018-06-27 09:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

James: Was the existing key permission change initiated by the ceph-mon or by the remote charm? Because this change takes a hash of the json request, a change initiated by the client should re-process fine as the sha would change'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2018-06-27 09:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28510, 'date': '2018-07-17 15:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Cache broker requests that have completed

Ceph-mon should keep track of the broker
requests that have been completed, rather
than retrying all requests on every iteration.

Change-Id: Ic579523d0a9e020ac82c697ab7ed2ef96b5d8d6e
Closes-Bug: #1773910
Depends-On: I9a77ce59b61ec74fd472e496b2df92da4ed01473

messages: [{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-13 13:20:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-07-13 19:28:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-07-17 11:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 13:20:47.000000000', 'message': 'api-ref: move to a v1.1 sub-folder

Make space for v2.
It should not break too much existing links, only the links to
local anchors (like #clusters, #jobs, etc) will be broken,
because it is not possible to redirect server-side based on an
URL fragment like that.
Luckily the generated content ends all in the same HTML page,
so the old links will end up in the new top-level index
which points to the index for v1.1 API documentation (and later
for v2). Not too bad.

Change-Id: I9a75e6567798b8d6d3deed8fc66e362ad2d86b5a
'}]
commit_message:
api-ref: move to a v1.1 sub-folder

Make space for v2.
It should not break too much existing links, only the links to
local anchors (like #clusters, #jobs, etc) will be broken,
because it is not possible to redirect server-side based on an
URL fragment like that.
Luckily the generated content ends all in the same HTML page,
so the old links will end up in the new top-level index
which points to the index for v1.1 API documentation (and later
for v2). Not too bad.

Change-Id: I9a75e6567798b8d6d3deed8fc66e362ad2d86b5a

and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

"}]
commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: I08dc76d61c6d762c75ca6594f0a33f0042da12f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-31 21:56:20.000000000', 'message': 'Mark database relation hooks as deprecated

Since Icehouse (at least) nova-compute does not need to access to the nova
database.

This patch marks the *-relation-joined hooks with the deprecated() decorator.
Then inclusion of the database credentials in nova.conf, when the relation
is aailable, is left intentionally to avoid unexpected restarts in
nova-compute daemon due to changes in nova.conf when the user upgrades
the charm.

Change-Id: I7c4f6a70785d7dad1727d52cf86508209849ca35
Closes-Bug: 1713807
'}, {'created': '2017-10-02 21:18:40.000000000', 'message': 'Remove databases relation

Since Icehouse nova-compute does not need to access to a database, all
accesses are made through nova-conductor.

This patch removes shared-db and pgsql-db relations with their hook
handlers.

Change-Id: I7c4f6a70785d7dad1727d52cf86508209849ca35
Closes-Bug: 1713807

commit_message:
Remove databases relation

Since Icehouse nova-compute does not need to access to a database, all
accesses are made through nova-conductor.

This patch removes shared-db relation and their hook handler.

Change-Id: I7c4f6a70785d7dad1727d52cf86508209849ca35
Closes-Bug: 1713807

[{'created': '2018-07-17 09:24:07.000000000', 'message': "Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: I0738b091824048c6e9b9ca38f3ae3818255e56f2
"}]
commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: I0738b091824048c6e9b9ca38f3ae3818255e56f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 07:36:33.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia0b0ae80af2e10fc305d67b333da6e1666390c4d
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia0b0ae80af2e10fc305d67b333da6e1666390c4d

    openstack database configuration default

subject: Prevent incorrect credentials
messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-16 08:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-16 09:10:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-16 11:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-16 11:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-16 14:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck -- timeout opensuse'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-17 08:53:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck -- timeout'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-17 09:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2018-07-17 12:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 08:32:29.000000000', 'message': "Prevent incorrect credentials

Currently 3 sets of credentials are generated for MQ, per service:
- rabbitmq_password
- oslomsg_rpc_password
- oslomsg_notify_password

In each service, we should use x_oslomsg_rpc_password and
x_oslomsg_notify_password, and not rabbitmq.

However there is no wiring as of today. This could lead
to a username like nova, on a vhost nova, with 3 different
passwords. Only one would work.

This patch ensures the wiring is done by default, for all
the roles to be able to use x_oslomsg_notify_password and
x_oslomsg_rpc_password. This is done by always referencing,
in the notify part, the credentials to the rpc part.

The RPC part is then a reference to the rabbitmq_password, so
it's easy to upgrade from queens to Rocky without changes.

If a deployer wants to override the credentials, he can
do so by uncommenting the appropriate line in the
user_secrets. This would then override the existing group_vars
and wire the secrets appropriately. A new user should be
used in that case, as written in the comments.

Change-Id: I834bdc5a33f6b3c49452a9948c889caa79659f3c
"}, {'created': '2018-07-16 09:10:04.000000000', 'message': "Prevent incorrect credentials

- rabbitmq_password
- oslomsg_rpc_password
- oslomsg_notify_password

In each service, we should use x_oslomsg_rpc_password and
x_oslomsg_notify_password, and not rabbitmq.

However there is no wiring as of today. This could lead
to a username like nova, on a vhost nova, with 3 different
passwords. Only one would work.

This patch ensures the wiring is done by default, for all
the roles to be able to use x_oslomsg_notify_password and
x_oslomsg_rpc_password. This is done by always referencing,
in the notify part, the credentials to the rpc part.

The RPC part is then a reference to the rabbitmq_password, so
it's easy to upgrade from queens to Rocky without changes.

If a deployer wants to override the credentials, he can
do so by uncommenting the appropriate line in the
user_secrets. This would then override the existing group_vars
and wire the secrets appropriately. A new user should be
used in that case, as written in the comments.

commit_message:
Prevent incorrect credentials

Currently 3 sets of credentials are generated for MQ, per service:
- rabbitmq_password
- oslomsg_rpc_password
- oslomsg_notify_password

In each service, we should use x_oslomsg_rpc_password and
x_oslomsg_notify_password, and not rabbitmq.

However there is no wiring as of today. This could lead
to a username like nova, on a vhost nova, with 3 different
passwords. Only one would work.

This patch ensures the wiring is done by default, for all
the roles to be able to use x_oslomsg_notify_password and
x_oslomsg_rpc_password. This is done by always referencing,
in the notify part, the credentials to the rpc part.

The RPC part is then a reference to the rabbitmq_password, so
it's easy to upgrade from queens to Rocky without changes.

If a deployer wants to override the credentials, he can
do so by uncommenting the appropriate line in the
user_secrets. This would then override the existing group_vars
and wire the secrets appropriately. A new user should be
used in that case, as written in the comments.

Change-Id: I834bdc5a33f6b3c49452a9948c889caa79659f3c

@Lance: In the recent release of oslo.policy you added Ia74bf6c40b1e05a1c958f4325e00f68be28d91b9 and glance is passing the result of context.to_policy_values() to enforce.

What's the right way to fix this?  It looks to be that we're catching a real failure in glance's use of oslo.context"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-07-16 14:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck

Just testing if the situation changed in any way'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-07-16 14:43:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It looks like the Enforcer.enforce typechecking (introduced with 775641a5) of the creds is breaking with mock. Add utility function which returns the most recommended datastore from a

commit_message:
Making immutable config setting when using <_IMMUTABLE_>.

Similar to what is done with os_service_default, but here we have the
possibility to tell puppet to not change the existing value, whatever
this is.

The associated fact for syntactic sugar in the module is
`::os_immutable`.

Partial-Bug: #1763322
Change-Id: Iaea44309db9b1b075425fa15890ba592d8bc9b7e
(cherry picked from commit 124daec7bb6563d48acf76f3141314ca1b7a58fe)

commit_message:
Move X-Target-Service-Catalog header to request body

To avoid sending too big headers, the X-Target-Service-Catalog
is moved into the request body. This is a new general way to pass
Out Of Band parameters. The parameters are then removed rom the
request body, thus, the content being processed is not changed
by this patch.

The original logic that processes the parameters in the header section
is reused, making this change completely backward compatible.

Change-Id: I1288d53f217453d4a3e64bf0f65e68e53dd51c4a
Closes-Bug: 1699248
Closes-Bug: 1702324

commit_message:
Move X-Target-Service-Catalog header to request body

To avoid sending too big headers, the X-Target-Service-Catalog
is moved into the request body. This is a new general way to pass
Out Of Band parameters.

Change-Id: I48b9b6edf810b82628ced8c0e4f545060725f9b6
Depends-On: I1288d53f217453d4a3e64bf0f65e68e53dd51c4a

commit_message:
Reformat tests.yaml via python yaml

The file was originally crafted by hand, and any future proposed
updates would have resulted in a large (mostly superfluous) diff.

This just gets ahead of that, as we look at ways to ramp up
test definition automation.

Change-Id: I116b7b9290823fa4545235c15c94c139aad7d69a

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-06-09 07:38:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-07-17 12:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 07:38:27.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I0e4d916aa22d9b5a62fe10418631fd8460ed6d1b
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I0e4d916aa22d9b5a62fe10418631fd8460ed6d1b

commit_message:
RemoteFS: don't fail in do_mount if already mounted

This fixes a problem where two different callers are
mounting a share at the same time:
    A: check if share is mounted
    B: check if share is mounted
    A: mount share
    B: mount share  (fails because it is already mounted)

Closes-Bug: 1780813
Change-Id: I6eca9c9e9eceb7aef357b0ed77bf157ac0010bfe

commit_message:
Enable translation for cloudkitty-dashboard

Allow translators to translate the dashboard.

This commit sets up related files according to the infra guide [1]. Also
removes Babel related entries in setup.cfg. They are not sufficient as
Django requires two PO files (django and djangojs).

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#django-projects

Change-Id: Ifc616d58a794d94f2f36823dcfee4f0165981b12
Task: 22816
Story: 2002867

commit_message:
objects: Add NUMACell.network_metadata

This will be used to keep track of the physical networks and potential
tunneled network that are affined with this given NUMA cell. It's
implemented by way of the recently added 'NetworkMetadata' object. We
don't currently populate this - that will come at the end of the series.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I9140ddae666f9c994c7954bc2e690ac1064a89de

commit_message:
Reformat tests.yaml via python yaml

The file was originally crafted by hand, and any future proposed
updates would have resulted in a large (mostly superfluous) diff.

This just gets ahead of that, as we look at ways to ramp up
test definition automation.

Change-Id: Ib99041a418dd4ccee8a3844f1cf7b2eecc56b5dd

commit_message:
move haproxy to neutron-metadata-agent

During pike cycle, haproxy is deployed on metadata agent for the
metadata proxy service. Adding the haproxy to the whole pkg list made
it install everywhere there is neutron installed. neutron server and
compute agent don't need to have haproxy installed. this patch move
haproxy to the neutron-metadata-agent group.

Change-Id: I1bd872a50ee506081b2d8274533a954a58a76fde
(cherry picked from commit 1f336be893735daf41f623b930a2538e00693153)

Change-Id: Idb98690f0bf11e6932fbe8c2930bb314b0dd3c48
'}, {'created': '2018-07-17 11:32:50.000000000', 'message': 'skip mapped LUKS devices in osdize_dev

commit_message:
skip mapped LUKS devices in osdize_dev

With BlueStore there are no file system mounts so having a simple check
for a LUKS header presence is good enough to avoid osdizing a used dev
which does not have an LVM super block indicating that a device is in
use.

Partial-Bug: #1781453

Change-Id: Idb98690f0bf11e6932fbe8c2930bb314b0dd3c48

commit_message:
Multi store support for http, swift, sheepdog and vmware driver

Added multi store support for http, swift, sheepdog and vmware driver.
The default behavior is maintained for backward compatibility.

DocImpact
Partial-Implements: bp multi-store

Change-Id: I93ccdafc6e740065ff4ca3adc6b49eb82e8afa10

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 07:01:48.000000000', 'message': 'Persist ceph-ansible fetch_directory

When scaling ceph monitors, ceph-ansible uses context from the
fetch_directory to prevent new monitors from behaving like they
are the only monitors.

Save the fetch_directory in swift after each ceph-ansible playbook
run; and if there is a fetch directory in swift, restore it before
each playbook run.

Change-Id: I4b576a6e7fbfb18fa13221e2d080bf7876a8303e
Closes-Bug: #1769769

'}, {'created': '2018-07-15 22:10:33.000000000', 'message': 'Persist ceph-ansible fetch_directory using mistral

When scaling ceph monitors, ceph-ansible uses context from the
fetch_directory to prevent new monitors from behaving like they
are the only monitors.

Save the fetch_directory in swift after each ceph-ansible playbook
run; and if there is a fetch directory in swift, restore it before
each playbook run.

Note that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582811 only resolves
1769769 for Master where config-download external deploy tasks
run ceph-ansible. This change change resolves 1769769 when using
mistral for Queens/Pike (when backported).

Change-Id: I4b576a6e7fbfb18fa13221e2d080bf7876a8303e
Depends-On: I995ad32345a39238ffb9cbcf9966dedc60c75ff8
Closes-Bug: #1769769

commit_message:
Persist ceph-ansible fetch_directory using mistral

When scaling ceph monitors, ceph-ansible uses context from the
fetch_directory to prevent new monitors from behaving like they
are the only monitors.

Save the fetch_directory in swift after each ceph-ansible playbook
run; and if there is a fetch directory in swift, restore it before
each playbook run.

Note that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582811 only resolves
1769769 for Master where config-download external deploy tasks
run ceph-ansible. This change resolves 1769769 when using mistral
for Queens/Pike (when backported).

Change-Id: I4b576a6e7fbfb18fa13221e2d080bf7876a8303e
Depends-On: I995ad32345a39238ffb9cbcf9966dedc60c75ff8
Closes-Bug: #1769769

commit_message:
Switch connection/become settings for cinder

Some services run on localhost. For that to work,
we need to sudo. Ideally it should rather be broken
out into its own playbook and use 'connection: local'
but to do that we'd have to know which service it is
and every role's inventory is different. So instead,
we use this rather horrible hack.

Change-Id: I8ce839a61eae5386edfa8171ffe95d22e5ff2c99

commit_message:
Fix rst errors in README

This fixes some rst formatting errors in the README file. The
readme is used as the package long description on pypi, and
they have recently enabled some checks that cause package
upload errors if there are formatting issues with the rst
content.

Change-Id: I3ff7a509c2b875606c985c87b61a63c5e15c1bda

[{'created': '2018-07-16 10:49:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix UC pre-flight for the missing templates dir

For some cases, the missing tht_path directory will be
populated later. Do validation against the default
t-h-t path then. That is RPM directory and it is ensured
via the package dependencies.

Related-bug: #1781600
Partial-bug: #1781227

Change-Id: I3615d9be8c706560661e3c266a24dbe6e14987f7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-07-17 08:51:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix UC pre-flight for the missing templates dir

Complements https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582529/.

For some cases, like mixed UC/OC deployments or
upgrades, the missing templates directory may be
passed in, so it will be populated later from the
default t-h-t RPM dir.  Run t-h-t validation
against that default t-h-t path then.  That is RPM
directory and it is ensured via the package
dependencies.

Related-bug: #1781600
Partial-bug: #1781227

Change-Id: I3615d9be8c706560661e3c266a24dbe6e14987f7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix UC pre-flight for the missing templates dir

Complements https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582529/.

For some cases, like mixed UC/OC deployments or
upgrades, the missing templates directory may be
passed in, so it will be populated later from the
default t-h-t RPM dir.  Run t-h-t validation
against that default t-h-t path then.  That is RPM
directory and it is ensured via the package
dependencies.

Related-bug: #1781600
Partial-bug: #1781227

Change-Id: I3615d9be8c706560661e3c266a24dbe6e14987f7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 09:09:12.000000000', 'message': "makedirs instead of mkdir when creating paths in Nexenta NFS & Quobyte

Use os.makedirs instead of os.mkdir when creating mount points.
The recent Cinder change [1] moved shell mkdir commands to pythons
os.mkdir commands. However as the shell commands were running with the
'-p' option os.makedirs is required instead.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580629/

Change-Id: I5a4155529e3c6dbc7f4d0e43561658bbba8a715d
Closes-Bug: #1780750
"}, {'created': '2018-07-10 07:03:29.000000000', 'message': 'Use os.makedirs instead of mkdir when creating paths

Use os.makedirs instead of shell based mkdir commands when creating
mount points.

Closes-Bug: #1780750

Change-Id: I5a4155529e3c6dbc7f4d0e43561658bbba8a715d
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 14:02:50.000000000', 'message': 'Use ensure_tree instead of mkdir when creating paths

Use fileutils.ensure_tree instead of shell based mkdir commands when
creating mount points.

Closes-Bug: #1780750

Change-Id: I5a4155529e3c6dbc7f4d0e43561658bbba8a715d
'}]
commit_message:
Use ensure_tree instead of mkdir when creating paths

Use fileutils.ensure_tree instead of shell based mkdir commands when
creating mount points.

Closes-Bug: #1780750

Change-Id: I5a4155529e3c6dbc7f4d0e43561658bbba8a715d

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

In order to pass the requirements check, a new lower bound is set for the
'pyasn1' and 'requests' packages.

Change-Id: I7c1a9f6e2e4f74b90a12ccf277f829b67b7f332f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 16:33:34.000000000', 'message': "Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Iee798c2660f69afe7c40cd3d2e9b801434944eff
"}, {'created': '2018-07-14 14:08:57.000000000', 'message': "Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Some old test cruft is also removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Iee798c2660f69afe7c40cd3d2e9b801434944eff
"}]
commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Some old test cruft is also removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Iee798c2660f69afe7c40cd3d2e9b801434944eff

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 12:51:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix populate templates dir for mixed UC/OC cases

If source templates dir does not exist, create it and populate from
the t-h-t system directory (installed from RPM).

Then retain the undercloud and overcloud --templates directories
separated to prevent versions collisions.

This may be the case for mixed UC/OC deployments or upgrades, which
require different versions of t-h-t either initially, or the versions
may diverge in the process of serial UC then OC update/upgrade.

Change-Id: I4cdc54662f6ec18d605c00a2c588c5bb1a56d14e
Partial-Bug: #1781577
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix populate templates dir for mixed UC/OC cases

If source templates dir does not exist, create it and populate from
the t-h-t system directory (installed from RPM).

Then retain the undercloud and overcloud --templates directories
separated to prevent versions collisions.

This may be the case for mixed UC/OC deployments or upgrades, which
require different versions of t-h-t either initially, or the versions
may diverge in the process of serial UC then OC update/upgrade.

Change-Id: I4cdc54662f6ec18d605c00a2c588c5bb1a56d14e
Partial-Bug: #1781577
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable externalIPs for DevStack's OpenShift

To prevent errors like:

  Failed to persist updated LoadBalancerStatus to service
  'default/kuryr-service-52130480': Service "kuryr-service-52130480" is
  invalid: spec.externalIPs: Forbidden: externalIPs have been disabled

in openshfit-master logs, this commit enables externalIPs.

Change-Id: I2b353c39091d11f4c19366e18d05d4b76c77581c
Closes-Bug: 1779894

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

the pylint.

'}, {'created': '2018-07-17 09:45:33.000000000', 'message': 'Change pylint requirement

pylint 2.0.0 and newer releases do not support Python 2, which breaks
Python 2 tests. This patch changes the requirement for pylint to use
version 1.9.1. The requirement is moved out of test-requirements.txt,
since pylint is not tracked in global requirements.

Change-Id: I2464ff2fc56b7fe7a92c40ec1555880f4e220479
'}]
commit_message:
Change pylint requirement

pylint 2.0.0 and newer releases do not support Python 2, which breaks
Python 2 tests. This patch changes the requirement for pylint to use
version 1.9.1. The requirement is moved out of test-requirements.txt,
since pylint is not tracked in global requirements.

Change-Id: I2464ff2fc56b7fe7a92c40ec1555880f4e220479

Change-Id: I672b0bf3f4fa64e0fad3edfd902756e0f4a75342

commit_message:
Pull in ldap dependencies via ldappool

For the transition from pyldap to python-ldap, we can use ldappool
to pull in the correct variant of ldap for us. so we don't need
to depend on pyldap nor python-ldap.

Change-Id: I672b0bf3f4fa64e0fad3edfd902756e0f4a75342

The externally consumed APIs from neutron.db.api were rehomed into
neutron-lib with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557040/

This patch consumes the retry_db_errors function from lib by:
- Removing retry_db_errors from neutron.db.api
- Updating the imports for retry_db_errors to use it from lib
- Using the DB API retry fixture from lib in the UTs where applicable
- Removing the UTs for neutron.db.api as they are now covered in lib

NeutronLibImpact

commit_message:
use retry_db_errors from neutron-lib

The externally consumed APIs from neutron.db.api were rehomed into
neutron-lib with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557040/

This patch consumes the retry_db_errors function from lib by:
- Removing retry_db_errors from neutron.db.api
- Updating the imports for retry_db_errors to use it from lib
- Using the DB API retry fixture from lib in the UTs where applicable
- Removing the UTs for neutron.db.api as they are now covered in lib

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I1feb842d3e0e92c945efb01ece29856335a398fe

commit_message:
doc: Fix arg specs and object types in docs

The usage doc stated that plug and unplug accept a single argument of
type `os_vif.objects.VIF`, which isn't a thing, and then went on to give
an example showing that they take two.  The usage doc and the plug and
unplug docstrings also listed various objects at the wrong paths (e.g.
the `instance_info` param being of type `os_vif.objects.InstanceInfo`,
which also isn't a thing).

Fixed up the usage doc to list both arguments and correct the references
in the sample code; and fixed the plug/unplug docstrings
to list the proper paths to classes: os_vif.objects.vif.VIFBase and
os_vif.objects.instance_info.InstanceInfo.

Made everything in `single backticks` into a proper rst ``literal``.

Change-Id: I400838bbe9663917fe2c64f52975b77a370405b4

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I38db902c553d25f528b3ba9a80e185705f327b24

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 22:39:17.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Adjust filters on listing availability zones

In before, filtering of AZs is using the filter implementation of
agents. To filter the AZs, users need to find the AZ fields to filter,
locate their corresponding fields in agent, and compile the filters
based on the mapping between AZ and agent. This is undesirable.

This patch improve the filtering of AZ by converting the AZ filters
to agent filters. The supporting AZ filters are:
* name: the name of the availability zone
* state: the value is either 'available' or 'unavailable'
* resource: the value is either 'network' or 'router'

Change-Id: Id882f949cc73a34290c311f3ce3d69d1b809c29f
"}, {'created': '2018-05-04 20:33:44.000000000', 'message': "Adjust filters on listing availability zones

commit_message:
Adjust filters on listing availability zones

In before, filtering of AZs is using the filter implementation of
agents. To filter the AZs, users need to find the AZ fields to filter,
locate their corresponding fields in agent, and compile the filters
based on the mapping between AZ and agent. This is undesirable.

This patch improve the filtering of AZ by converting the AZ filters
to agent filters. The supporting AZ filters are:
* name: the name of the availability zone
* state: the value is either 'available' or 'unavailable'
* resource: the value is either 'network' or 'router'

NOTE: For backward-compatibility, the old filters still works but
its usage is discourage.

APIImpact: Add filters to specify attributes of availability zones

Needed-By: Icbf427f20ca912a40d68e8042abeeabffeb3005f
Change-Id: Id882f949cc73a34290c311f3ce3d69d1b809c29f

[{'created': '2018-07-12 07:25:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix get LoadBalancer IP implementation

For services of Type 'LoadBalancer'  Kuryr controller stores the
External IP at service.status.
In some cases, OpenShift may overwrite the service.status value.
This patch updates 'get_service_ip' to return the IP that was allocated by Kuryr controller.

Change-Id: Ia5f766ba938e2972c022fb1e7cbf3c0374a344f2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix get LoadBalancer IP implementation

For services of Type 'LoadBalancer'  Kuryr controller stores the
External IP at service.status.
In some cases, OpenShift may overwrite the service.status value.
This patch updates 'get_service_ip' to return the IP that was allocated by Kuryr controller.

Change-Id: Ia5f766ba938e2972c022fb1e7cbf3c0374a344f2

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.

Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Idf2f91565f9205c745a7110be5bf81267bd3caf5
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Only run nova status-check once a compute host has registered

The placement service doesn't work correctly until a compute host
has registered and the cellv2_discover has run.

To make sure this happens, we perform the status check after the
cell_v2 discover on the same conductor node which performed it.

Change-Id: Ie6e2463549f71f845148cac7cf09db3d0feb59d2

subject: Remove redundant apt cache update task
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-13 11:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-13 12:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2018-07-13 18:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-13 21:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-14 13:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-07-17 08:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-17 09:19:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 11:52:09.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant apt cache update task

There's no reason for this task to be in its own file.
It's not used anywhere but this play. The task also is
not necessary, given that every role does its own updates
when it needs to and the test execution does a cache
update right at the start in order to install the dependent
packages.

All in all, this is a waste of time, so let's just purge it.

commit_message:
Remove redundant apt cache update task

There's no reason for this task to be in its own file.
It's not used anywhere but this play. The task also is
not necessary, given that every role does its own updates
when it needs to and the test execution does a cache
update right at the start in order to install the dependent
packages.

All in all, this is a waste of time, so let's just purge it.

Change-Id: I9cc872189b87eb65c4ee7623d4141be41d207f7a

commit_message:
Add logic to create PReP partition for ppc64* arch

When booting a partition image localy, ppc64* expects an 8 MiB
partition, with the prep and boot flags set, containing the
bootloader [0]. This patch adds logic to ironic-lib to create
the parition with these flags when the node has a ppc64* arch.

[0] https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/community/wikis/home?lang=en#!/wiki/W51a7ffcf4dfd_4b40_9d82_446ebc23c550/page/PowerLinux%20Boot%20howto

Change-Id: I8f9748dd58146bfb2411c229b02969e0faf18222
Story: #1749057
Task: #22998

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I9ce106569ced891c551b36506d360e4b8718c7e3

"}, {'created': '2018-07-16 13:52:24.000000000', 'message': "Use local connection and become for nova_compute

The nova_compute group contains localhost, but due to
the name being different, it was missed in [1].

When targeting localhost with 'remote_user: root' and
using 'become: yes' we lose the environment variables
for the user running the playbook (eg: USER, HOME).

However, if we use 'connection: local' and 'become: yes'
together, it works properly. We apply this change to
ensure this play also has the correct access to change
things on the host.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/582359
Change-Id: Ia87e02c3b965be6f384d2f64911f0af2e4c2d598
"}]
commit_message:
Use local connection and become for nova_compute

The nova_compute group contains localhost, but due to
the name being different, it was missed in [1].

When targeting localhost with 'remote_user: root' and
using 'become: yes' we lose the environment variables
for the user running the playbook (eg: USER, HOME).

However, if we use 'connection: local' and 'become: yes'
together, it works properly. We apply this change to
ensure this play also has the correct access to change
things on the host.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/582359
Change-Id: Ia87e02c3b965be6f384d2f64911f0af2e4c2d598

[{'created': '2018-07-13 12:02:38.000000000', 'message': "Allow access to K8s API LB from the host

We should contact K8s API through the LB we're creating for that
purpose. Turns out that's impossible with LBaaS v2 and openvswitch
firewall driver.

This commit fixes that by adding required SGs to LB and kubelet port to
allow incoming traffic.

Closes-Bug 1781584

Change-Id: I7c7d6860471c1eb2804935d8dddfa771289abc49
"}]
commit_message:
Allow access to K8s API LB from the host

We should contact K8s API through the LB we're creating for that
purpose. Turns out that's impossible with LBaaS v2 and openvswitch
firewall driver.

This commit fixes that by adding required SGs to LB and kubelet port to
allow incoming traffic.

Closes-Bug 1781584

Change-Id: I7c7d6860471c1eb2804935d8dddfa771289abc49

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/582359
Change-Id: Ic844753c3ece4383eefa490f00be0bff441c6a7e

commit_message:
heat plugin: resources depend on the API extension being enabled

The Heat resource definition need to state that the resources
exist only if the 'bgpvpn' API extension is enabled in neutron.

Change-Id: I324e9c88564d000d654f694effa57c671165939d

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: Ia6c57495b8d6090a0b98f17554288a310388c3e2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 16:45:27.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I8b2f1a62f8c9ca04d6c63f4a4ad22ec445bad88b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I8b2f1a62f8c9ca04d6c63f4a4ad22ec445bad88b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

but not thereafter since starting in stable/queens
containerized deployment of manila is supported.

commit_message:
Cleanup unittest file loading

Followup patch to update how test files are loaded accross all project:
- don't specify 'r' when opening a file as it is default mode
- use json.load(file) instead of json.loads(string)
- in some cases use file path inline instead of defining new var
- use loops to load several related files to avoid repetitive code

Change-Id: Ib4a66a4d97e7025849e3f84fc489fa1fa98af327

[{'created': '2018-07-12 18:37:37.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I81bb3f872dc93e54861cb720e3b37ab7660a074a

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I81bb3f872dc93e54861cb720e3b37ab7660a074a

https://requestb.in/1ivrvri1

Threshold rules should be combined with "and" or "or" (HTTP 400)

Closes-Bug: #1757973

commit_message:
Incorrect error when using incorrect data in type of composite rule

aodh alarm create --type event --name mack --type composite
--composite-rule '{"or": [{"type": "ahhdhfjffkk"}]}' --alarm-action
https://requestb.in/1ivrvri1

Threshold rules should be combined with "and" or "or" (HTTP 400)
Error seems not relevant for the incorrect data.

Change-Id: I386e298c9cea25464c00ada37ddd18d24d1fd6ca
Closes-Bug: #1757973

[{'created': '2017-03-10 14:05:46.000000000', 'message': "WA for udevadm settle loops

There is an issue with 'udevadm settle' command described at [1]. It
turns out that inconsistent task IDs stored in queue.bin and
uevent_seqnum could cause udevadm settle to loop trying to find
the task that doesn't exist. Kernel developers are skeptical about
this issue and not willing to fix it, but even if they will, we
still will take it to MOS.

By default, it uses a timeout of 180 seconds that is inconsistent
with a set of existing nailgun-agent's timeouts. We can change this
timeout and I think that 15 sec will be a reasonable value

[1] https://lists.gt.net/linux/kernel/1524376

Change-Id: I0e71786c3516463496a313ea17438582a45ad2aa
Closes-bug: #1665584
"}, {'created': '2017-03-10 14:12:11.000000000', 'message': "WA for udevadm settle loops

Change-Id: I0e71786c3516463496a313ea17438582a45ad2aa

commit_message:
WA for udevadm settle loops

There is an issue with 'udevadm settle' command described at [1]. It
turns out that inconsistent task IDs stored in queue.bin and
uevent_seqnum could cause udevadm settle to loop trying to find
the task that doesn't exist. Kernel developers are skeptical about
this issue and not willing to fix it, but even if they will, we
still will take it to MOS.

By default, it uses a timeout of 180 seconds that is inconsistent
with a set of existing nailgun-agent's timeouts. We can change this
timeout and I think that 15 sec will be a reasonable value

[1] https://lists.gt.net/linux/kernel/1524376

Change-Id: I0e71786c3516463496a313ea17438582a45ad2aa
Closes-bug: #1665584

commit_message:
DeployIdentifier should be provided for any parameter actions

DeployIdentifier is update during the deployment workflow in the
tripleo_common, but all the parameter update and get workflows,
before the depoloyment will fail since the parameter is not provided
for the heat stack validation. Adding a dummy entry for the DeployIdentifier
in the tripleoclient which will be replaced to a timestamp in the
deploy workflow.

Closes-Bug: #1759326
Change-Id: I26cc11895a376788d8aad41727676bec73a15d69
(cherry picked from commit 4cb7a225297e804fb00c037904142dea9262475b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 12:29:13.000000000', 'message': 'mysql/undercloud: add condition for upgrade

The MySQL commands that we run during the upgrade of MySQL are useful
when upgrading a non-containerized undercloud (from instack-undercloud)
to a containerized undercloud, because we need to rename the Neutron
database to match with the defaults in THT.
So these 2 steps are only useful when MariaDB was actually running on
the host and not in a container.
Adding a conditional that checks if MariaDB is running and then we can
run these MySQL commands will ensure we can run the undercloud upgrade
in Rocky and beyond.

Change-Id: I34f3d5bae4838793fcbbc8832f288b11e6cd81f0
'}]
commit_message:
mysql/undercloud: add condition for upgrade

The MySQL commands that we run during the upgrade of MySQL are useful
when upgrading a non-containerized undercloud (from instack-undercloud)
to a containerized undercloud, because we need to rename the Neutron
database to match with the defaults in THT.
So these 2 steps are only useful when MariaDB was actually running on
the host and not in a container.
Adding a conditional that checks if MariaDB is running and then we can
run these MySQL commands will ensure we can run the undercloud upgrade
in Rocky and beyond.

Change-Id: I34f3d5bae4838793fcbbc8832f288b11e6cd81f0

I think you will need to allow additionalProperties in schema for create volume or you can add a new micro version in which you can add schema validation support otherwise it would break all applications until patch [1] is merged and these applications doesn't upgrade python-cinderclient to the newest version.

These are all applications using python-cinderclient [2] in OpenStack ecosystem.
Making changes to all these projects/applications is a huge task and it would take long time to merge and upgrade python-cinderclient to the newest version.

[1] : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573622/
[2] : http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=python-cinderclient%3E%3D&i=nope&files=&repos="}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-06-12 11:18:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

It's a good change and I'm all OK with such validation. But I don't think that we need to change microversion here. It's mostly bugfixing. If a user did a valid API request nothing will be changed. I hope it's won't be an issue for most of API consumers (I mean not only python-cinderclient one.

If other cores think that bumping microversion for such kind of changes are good for cinder, please, ignore my -1. I didn't find guidelines for it now :("}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-06-22 19:20:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks a lot to Sean McGinnis for the link: https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/api_microversion_dev.html#when-do-i-need-a-new-microversion'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-28 11:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I do think this does require the microversion bump since we are changing what is allowed as input and it can be a breaking change in behavior.

A few minor things inline that I think would be good to clean up though. Thanks for working on this.'}, {'account_id': 24645, 'date': '2018-06-29 06:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2018-06-29 07:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: Volumes

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Volumes API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes
* PUT  /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}

Adding new Microversion 3.53, this will have impact on  both Create
and Update Volume API

* Create volume API will not accept additional properties like
  (user_id, project_id, status and attach_status).
* Update volume API will require minimum one parameter in request
  body otherwise it will raise 400 error.

APIImpact :
Before 3.53 version, create volume allows additional properties,
but now it will raise 400 error.
Also before 3.53 version, update volume allows empty body {},
but now it will raise 400 error.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1774155
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: I1829b6796cd6d3fa1040dd0fb9280bec5bdbc92e

commit_message:
Support alias for execution creation

This commit to support alias for execution creation, to create execution
only use function_alias pramater, and get function_id and function_version
from function_alias. Also add function tests for execution creation.

Change-Id: Iea6d3b3ac3d58d539fae88ffe455013ad08d2c43
Story: #2002143
Task: #19986

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 01:53:20.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I634e5ed6236ff0253b713b411ab203072485af2c
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I634e5ed6236ff0253b713b411ab203072485af2c

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I9a52c912ef5ad19fe24e9294f573a2770436d5e3

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7390869151d7bf6390b513ea078d4909d7d73055

[{'created': '2018-07-11 10:39:38.000000000', 'message': 'Send update instead of remove for DVR reschedule

The current "agent remove-add" method to reschedule a router is not
friendly for DVR. In DVR cases, the old agent may still need to keep the
router in a non-master role to service any VM ports that exit on that
host while the new agent handles the master role of the router.

This patch proposes to send "update" instead of "remove" notification
for DVR rescheduling, which aligns with the retain_router check in
remove_router_from_l3_agent as well.

Closes-Bug: #1781179
Change-Id: I23431f9f46f72e6bce91f3d1fb0ed328d55930fb

commit_message:
Send update instead of remove for DVR reschedule

The current "agent remove-add" method to reschedule a router is not
friendly for DVR. In DVR cases, the old agent may still need to keep the
router in a non-master role to service any VM ports that exit on that
host while the new agent handles the master role of the router.

This patch proposes to send "update" instead of "remove" notification
for DVR rescheduling, which aligns with the retain_router check in
remove_router_from_l3_agent as well.

Closes-Bug: #1781179
Change-Id: I23431f9f46f72e6bce91f3d1fb0ed328d55930fb

[{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-20 18:45:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-20 19:32:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-03-21 11:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Andreas.  This change mostly looks good, but unfortunately the change in setup from 'pbr' to 'pbr>=2.0.0' breaks RPM and Debian package building for me.  I think I might be able to fix my RPM process for 'pbr>=2.0.0', but I'm currently not aware of a possible solution at all for the Debian process.  Would it work to make all of these changes except for the ones that affect the PBR constraint?

In more detail:

I do RPM building on a CentOS machine that I've set up myself.  The error there is:

+ /usr/bin/python setup.py build
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 29, in <module>
    pbr=True)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/distutils/core.py", line 112, in setup
    _setup_distribution = dist = klass(attrs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 265, in __init__
    self.fetch_build_eggs(attrs.pop('setup_requires'))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 289, in fetch_build_eggs
    parse_requirements(requires), installer=self.fetch_build_egg
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 630, in resolve
    raise VersionConflict(dist,req) # XXX put more info here
pkg_resources.VersionConflict: (pbr 1.10.0 (/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages), Requirement.parse('pbr>=2.0.0'))

I guess that I will be able to fix that by installing a newer PBR on that machine.

I do Debian package building, for Trusty and Xenial, by using PPAs on launchpad.net; this means that it's launchpad that does the building, and I have less control over the environment.  The error there for Xenial is:

dh clean  --with python2,systemd
   dh_testdir
   dh_auto_clean
	python setup.py clean -a
Download error on https://pypi.python.org/simple/pbr/: [Errno -2] Name or service not known -- Some packages may not be found!
Couldn't find index page for 'pbr' (maybe misspelled?)
Download error on https://pypi.python.org/simple/: [Errno -2] Name or service not known -- Some packages may not be found!
No local packages or download links found for pbr>=2.0.0
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 29, in <module>
    pbr=True)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/core.py", line 111, in setup
    _setup_distribution = dist = klass(attrs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 269, in __init__
    self.fetch_build_eggs(attrs['setup_requires'])
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 313, in fetch_build_eggs
    replace_conflicting=True,
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 826, in resolve
    dist = best[req.key] = env.best_match(req, ws, installer)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 1092, in best_match
    return self.obtain(req, installer)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 1104, in obtain
    return installer(requirement)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 380, in fetch_build_egg
    return cmd.easy_install(req)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/setuptools/command/easy_install.py", line 657, in easy_install
    raise DistutilsError(msg)
distutils.errors.DistutilsError: Could not find suitable distribution for Requirement.parse('pbr>=2.0.0')
dh_auto_clean: python setup.py clean -a returned exit code 1

For Trusty the error is identical except for changing line numbers.

Do you have any suggestions?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-21 11:36:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Neil, I'm surprised that this just hits you here - should be a broader problem. WE have that in many projects...

I can make the change for pbr here but that's just a specific workaround not helping all other projects."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-21 11:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-07-16 20:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-17 04:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-17 06:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-07-17 07:18:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Update requirements handling

Do not use -U for requirements, it will update requirements which can
lead to installation of unwanted versions.

Give test-requirements the usual name so that our jobs handle it
properly.

Add neutron to test-requirements so that Depends-On works. OpenStack CI
will install from git.

Update requirements to current version so that requirements check
passes. Remove unused markupsafe requirement.

Change-Id: I8ed063d024055077aef75cda2acc13af0d90c2bd

[{'created': '2018-07-16 18:15:12.000000000', 'message': 'vars: SUSE: Drop python-pycrypto from SUSE packages

Commit c41b80cee994 ("Remove python-crypto and use in-repo GPG keys")
removed the ancient python-crypto package from CentOS but it didn't do
it for SUSE. Similar to CentOS, we don't need python-crypto anymore for
Galera so we can simply drop it.

Fixes: c41b80cee994 ("Remove python-crypto and use in-repo GPG keys")
Change-Id: If8fc1641cc26e98e2851ccae95827fcfc4794282
'}]
commit_message:
vars: SUSE: Drop python-pycrypto from SUSE packages

Commit c41b80cee994 ("Remove python-crypto and use in-repo GPG keys")
removed the ancient python-crypto package from CentOS but it didn't do
it for SUSE. Similar to CentOS, we don't need python-crypto anymore for
Galera so we can simply drop it.

Fixes: c41b80cee994 ("Remove python-crypto and use in-repo GPG keys")
Change-Id: If8fc1641cc26e98e2851ccae95827fcfc4794282

commit_message:
Update glance documentation for trait support

Required traits on the image allow specifying a server to be
built only on compute nodes which express those traits. The
Nova Scheduler has been updated to look at the image trait
properties when selecting compute nodes.

Updating the documentation for glance to explain the same.

Documentation is similar to flavor required traits documentation available
here: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/flavors.html#extra-specs

Change-Id: I716821abf44238eecc9c4a1d198d8a31b87dedce
Implements: blueprint glance-image-traits

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ieca57f7c2e6b2ff5c95f8643985ad760c71e0fc3

commit_message:
Add PublicIPAddress manager for Hyper-V Network Virtualization (SDN 2.0)

The PublicIPAddressManager will be used by the HNVMechanismDriver.

Co-Authored-By: Alexandru Coman <acoman@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support

Change-Id: Ia715872447ade75ef59d2182907123df19bacef9

commit_message:
Add LoadBalancer manager for Hyper-V Network Virtualization (SDN 2.0)

The LoadBalancerManager will be used by the HNVMechanismDriver.

Co-Authored-By: Alexandru Coman <acoman@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support
