commit_message:
Add HNV layer 3 router plugin

Co-Authored-By: Alexandru Coman <acoman@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support
Change-Id: I30b1d91da410d1f7ce34508fd5f31da075d6b2b3

subject: Add HNV mechanism driver

[{'created': '2018-07-12 14:17:20.000000000', 'message': 'Support deploying Monasca Log Persister

This is a Logstash component which reads processed logs from Kafka
and writes them to Elasticsearch (or some other backend supported by
Logstash).

Ingesting the logs from this service with Fluentd will be covered under
a different commit.

Change-Id: I2d722991ab2072c54c4715507b19a4c9279f921b

commit_message:
Support deploying Monasca Log Persister

This is a Logstash component which reads processed logs from Kafka
and writes them to Elasticsearch (or some other backend supported by
Logstash).

Ingesting the logs from this service with Fluentd will be covered under
a different commit.

Change-Id: I2d722991ab2072c54c4715507b19a4c9279f921b
Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 04:54:22.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifb92a05cafc6d10150cc65f222e29934d15578bb
'}, {'created': '2018-07-11 00:18:23.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifb92a05cafc6d10150cc65f222e29934d15578bb
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifb92a05cafc6d10150cc65f222e29934d15578bb

commit_message:
make quickstart.sh more user friendly with pip errors

quickstart.sh will swallow pip related errors and
run through until the ansible-playbook invocation.
This confuses users often.

Ensure that when there is an error w/ setting up the
the requirements from requirements.txt or
quickstart-extras-requirements that we fail appropriately
and print an error message.

Change-Id: Ibcbbcba9b0e3d4e9bb76f54dfd070bb768942e64

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 08:46:10.000000000', 'message': 'Catch exceptions for session client

Exceptions from the API were not properly catched when it uses
keystone session client path. As a result, error messages in the
response body from blazar REST APIs were not displayed.

This patch fixes it creating the new SessionClient class, which
is basically the same as its parent class, but it can raise
BlazarClientException if requests to the blazar server failed.

Change-Id: I98ba3949742f2a987beb7e16400608b8ebb60065

commit_message:
Catch exceptions for session client

Exceptions from the API were not properly caught when it uses
keystone session client path. As a result, error messages in the
response body from blazar REST APIs were not displayed.

This patch fixes it creating the new SessionClient class, which
is basically the same as its parent class, but it can raise
BlazarClientException if requests to the blazar server failed.

Change-Id: I98ba3949742f2a987beb7e16400608b8ebb60065
Closes-Bug: #1777548

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is maintained
project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ib27496313447cac962e4849223ab9eb96a9d873f

commit_message:
Add log-list to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the log-list command.

The trove command log-list is now:
    openstack database log list

Change-Id: If048a653df01244882a451e3fddf28a8faac59f6
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We can't set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36 due to https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/425

Change-Id: Id7854d34f756850cd7550513abf90e7aa9fa0c0b

commit_message:
Update yaml files for Dell EMC VNX, Unity drivers

1. manila-backend-vnx.yaml:
  a. remove ManilaVNXServerMetaPool since meta_pool is not used by Manila VNX driver
  b. add ManilaVNXServerContainer

2. cinder-dellemc-vnx-config.yaml:
  a. remove default value of CinderDellEMCVNXStorageSecurityFileDir since it is not medatory option for Cinder VNX driver

Change-Id: Ie48cec52df720f3a13700d6048ecf78ba9067b51
Closes-bug: #1774942

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Remove central_external_bridge

It is not necessary to use 2 "central" bridges, one for "data" and
one for "external" network simulation.
Also using 2 bridge will cause problems when "external_network_bridge"
option will be removed from L3 agent and it will use integration bridge
as it should be done.

Change-Id: I68ee51cbc148b2bfce0cba8de7cf9fe08df54c96

Shouldn't we use decorators for this? ie. @base.skip_if_microversion_not_supported()"}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2018-07-17 02:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-07-17 03:50:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-15 10:30:59.000000000', 'message': 'Skip tests for unsupported micro-versions

Add/Fix the use of the skipping logic for
tests that are meant to make requests and
seek responses off a micro-version greater
than the configured maximum microversion.

Change-Id: Ib847af1ca88f5c3a2d2d9f4f48bfe40dfd50b1c9
'}]
commit_message:
Skip tests for unsupported micro-versions

Add/Fix the use of the skipping logic for
tests that are meant to make requests and
seek responses off a micro-version greater
than the configured maximum microversion.

Change-Id: Ib847af1ca88f5c3a2d2d9f4f48bfe40dfd50b1c9

[{'created': '2018-07-16 16:23:05.000000000', 'message': 'Use glance.context.RequestContext in tests

There were some recent changes to oslo.policy that include specific
type checks of the ``creds`` parameter passed to the ``enforce()``
method:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578995/

The above change allows consuming projects to pass instances
of oslo_context.context.RequestContext to the policy enforcer, as
opposed to building a dictionary instance from scratch multiple
different ways across projects.

The glance unit tests were failing with the new version of
oslo.policy (1.38.0) because they were passing in a Mock instance
which failed the new, more strict, type check.

This commit converts the setUp class of the tests to use an instance
of glance.context.RequestContext, which subclasses RequestContext
from oslo.context. It also sets the user_id and project_id attributes
of the context object to override authorization checks.

This should allow glance to pass with newer versions of oslo.policy.

commit_message:
Use glance.context.RequestContext in tests

There were some recent changes to oslo.policy that include specific
type checks of the ``creds`` parameter passed to the ``enforce()``
method:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578995/

The above change allows consuming projects to pass instances
of oslo_context.context.RequestContext to the policy enforcer, as
opposed to building a dictionary instance from scratch multiple
different ways across projects.

The glance unit tests were failing with the new version of
oslo.policy (1.38.0) because they were passing in a Mock instance
which failed the new, more strict, type check.

This commit converts the setUp class of the tests to use an instance
of glance.context.RequestContext, which subclasses RequestContext
from oslo.context. It also sets the user_id and project_id attributes
of the context object to override authorization checks.

This should allow glance to pass with newer versions of oslo.policy.

Change-Id: I0a69bc9565d57fd6ad8484abc5fce0e8dd45f9f2
Closes-Bug: 1781976

commit_message:
Use undercloud kernel when not overcloud_as_undercloud

Review [1] switched to virt-copy-out to get the overcloud
kernel and initramfs from the undercloud image. But in
case where overcloud_as_undercloud=false, running undercloud
with these old kernel and initramfs can create issues.
This patch will get the latest kernel from undercloud.qcow2
using virt-get-kernel and use those while running undercloud
vm.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408773

Change-Id: I39b86887b58036462f805e22842ec585534cadfa

commit_message:
Tidy Heartbeat service names

Remove spaces in service names, and don't duplicate the protocol as
heartbeat includes these into the monitor.scheme and monitor.id
fields by default.

Change-Id: If7633dd5ca23c22eff37a8b7140fff4bf0911432

commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I297db6f1eea3416797fceae55a3e13c5a260435c

commit_message:
Enable bashate use with pre-commit

commit_message:
Allow bashate to be called as a module

Adops official way of calling a module as a script.
Now user can do `python -m bashate ...` which can prove
to be useful when scripts cannot be installed or
when debugging is desired, or use of specific
python interpreter.

Change-Id: I7b3085df3e9f5874cf22470fec15c1b0532c846d
Signed-off-by: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

commit_message:
z/VM Driver: Initial change set of z/VM driver

This is the first change that implements basic virt.driver methods
to allow nova-compute process start successfully.

A set of subsequent changes will implement spawn, snapshot, destroy
and instance power actions.

Change-Id: Ica6117c2c64f7518b78b7fb02487622250638e88
blueprint: add-zvm-driver-rocky

commit_message:
fix get_numeric_data

The change[1] introduced a failure for the grouped-runs page, there
is a case where if no data is provided to get_numeric_data it will error
with[2]

This change aims to fix that error by returning get_numeric_data early
if no data is provided.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547866/
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/725854/

Change-Id: I02e9f40f4dcd44aefb47f5c8c96d9a318e034189

commit_message:
Synchronize on network attach/detach

There are race conditions on concurrent network attach/detach
requests on the same container. We need to lock down the container
before doing these operations. Due to this change, the RPC call
will be blocking so we switch from RPC call to RPC cast so that
it won't block the API thread.

Change-Id: Ieca5bdfe5ca427f30c889bf5fc82c49a104d1477

commit_message:
Fall back to the legacy auth_uri option

In before, we switched from 'auth_uri' to 'www_authenticate_uri' [1]
in a backward-incompatible way, which breaks the legacy setup.
For example, if users install Zun with Pike or earlier version
of OpenStack, it will break.

This patch fixes it by fall back to the legacy option 'auth_uri'
if 'www_authenticate_uri' is not presented. In addition, a unnecessary
import_opt statement is removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568457/

Change-Id: I5e3535f8dbfac73e56190442a31943ac22562ffb
(cherry picked from commit cc0f66218f5679ac789e18007fddb1ea51c506e4)

commit_message:
Switch keystone session in glanceclient

We are using keystone session to construct a neutron/cinder client.
This patch align it with glancecleint. As a result, the codebase
is easier to maintain.

Change-Id: I66b53b834fb02945089b0b2acb8e38ae4e94924f
(cherry picked from commit 58f7b932587236a045023c8c03fbf18fcc835208)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 15:30:23.000000000', 'message': 'Adding python-ldap to global requirements

To allow other openstack projects switch from the deprecated pyldap
library to python-ldap we need to enable it as part of global-requirements.
After the transition path is complete we can remove pyldap (which is merely
a wrapper around python-ldap meanwhile, so it is effectively a noop).

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes - last release less than two months ago

Is the library good code?
Should be, it was the best of breedh from old ldap module and pyldap
(which introduced api fixes for python 3.x compatibility)

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes

Is the library license compatible?
Yes - PSF

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest
/ Fedora latest)?

Yes, already part of Ubuntu Bionic.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?

Yes, pyldap is the deprecated but already contained library.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Yes, needed by keystone and others.

Change-Id: I671675ca967502bae803ab510f9d9d3c0d58a60d
'}]
commit_message:
Adding python-ldap to global requirements

To allow other openstack projects switch from the deprecated pyldap
library to python-ldap we need to enable it as part of global-requirements.
After the transition path is complete we can remove pyldap (which is merely
a wrapper around python-ldap meanwhile, so it is effectively a noop).

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes - last release less than two months ago

Is the library good code?
Should be, it was the best of breedh from old ldap module and pyldap
(which introduced api fixes for python 3.x compatibility)

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes

Is the library license compatible?
Yes - PSF

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest
/ Fedora latest)?

Yes, already part of Ubuntu Bionic.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?

Yes, pyldap is the deprecated but already contained library.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Yes, needed by keystone and others.

Change-Id: I671675ca967502bae803ab510f9d9d3c0d58a60d

[{'created': '2018-07-16 07:39:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add VNC SSL options

The options ssl_only, cert, and key in the DEFAULT
section in nova.conf is mainly (and only?) used to
configure SSL and certificates for VNC.

However since they are in the DEFAULT section and are
generic for Nova my opinion is that they should be
in nova::init.

For information about these options see [1] and [2].
They are not deprecated so should be no issues adding
them in.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/queens/admin/remote-console-access.html
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/conf/novnc.py

Change-Id: Ice51fe175bdc1cb14fa49cf53d1f38e9728bbb60
(cherry picked from commit 9c6b39b93af2f3fa4c321cfd827f38a2de325389)
'}]
commit_message:
Add VNC SSL options

The options ssl_only, cert, and key in the DEFAULT
section in nova.conf is mainly (and only?) used to
configure SSL and certificates for VNC.

However since they are in the DEFAULT section and are
generic for Nova my opinion is that they should be
in nova::init.

For information about these options see [1] and [2].
They are not deprecated so should be no issues adding
them in.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/queens/admin/remote-console-access.html
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/conf/novnc.py

Change-Id: Ice51fe175bdc1cb14fa49cf53d1f38e9728bbb60
(cherry picked from commit 9c6b39b93af2f3fa4c321cfd827f38a2de325389)

[{'created': '2018-07-15 20:45:11.000000000', 'message': 'mnaio: Only resize machines00 LV when defaulting to systemd-nspawn

Commit 875fa96f / change-id Ief0040f6 unintentionally tries to enlarge
the "machines00" LV when LXC is the default container technology which
fails due to the Debian automated installation having assigned all the
space within the associated "vmvg00" VG.

As the intention of the aforementioned commit was to apply when
systemd-nspawn was used, codify that explicitly in a `when:` condition
on the problematic Ansible task.

Change-Id: I56ec1290d71d0d09db447e347d7d55432d9b81c6
Signed-off-by: Corey Wright <corey.wright@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1781823

commit_message:
mnaio: Only resize Swift & Cinder machines00 LV when using nspawn

Commit 875fa96f / change-id Ief0040f6 unintentionally tries to enlarge
the "machines00" LV when LXC is the default container technology which
fails due to the Debian automated installation having assigned all the
space within the associated "vmvg00" VG.

As the intention of the aforementioned commit was to apply when
systemd-nspawn was used, codify that explicitly in a `when:` condition
on the problematic Ansible task.

Change-Id: I56ec1290d71d0d09db447e347d7d55432d9b81c6
Signed-off-by: Corey Wright <corey.wright@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1781823

commit_message:
Increase test coverage of entity_type id mapping query

We recently added support that allows managers to query the
id_mapping backend by entity_type (e.g. USER or GROUP):

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572446/

This patch just adds another test case that makes sure we can query
for groups in addition to users.

Change-Id: I74834e4f188b0a8fa12824ca831f9a65f6f05170

commit_message:
Filter by entity_type in get_domain_mapping_list

with many users and groups in a domain fetching all mappings (for both
users and groups) may become inefficient.

In an environment with approx 125k users and 150 groups in the mapping
table and SAML2+LDAP auth/backend, this patch reduced the time
for first (uncached) 'openstack token issue' command from 12 to 3 seconds.
Similar improvements were seen with time to login to Horizon as well.

Change-Id: Iccbef534ff7e723f8b1461bb1169e2da66cc1dea
Closes-Bug: #1775207

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 17:02:32.000000000', 'message': 'PUT+POST: break out putter specific test classes

In test_obj.py there are PUT tests that are specific
to the Putter type and others that apply to any Putter type.
This patch refactors them into separate classes to provide
greater clarity and to allow common tests to be applied to
each Putter type.

commit_message:
PUT+POST: break out putter specific test classes

In test_obj.py there are PUT tests that are specific to the Putter
type and others that apply to any Putter type. This patch refactors
them into separate classes to provide greater clarity and to allow
common tests to be applied to each Putter type.

Taking this infrastracture out and ahead of PUT+POST itself allows
it to be reviewed much easier, especially when you look at the diff.

Related-Change-Id: I64b0d8fdb2ffce786f56665a74ed7eb2603abfda
Change-Id: Ibb09b5a28098fb51e25ab5a7134b518cc68eaf89

invalid data in request body.

commit_message:
Add support for dynamic routing bpg dragent

This patch adds support to install and configure the
bgp dynamic routing agent. It also install the
dynamic-routing package since that is required by
the bgp dragent.

These packages already exists on Debian and Ubuntu but
since it was removed from RPM packages when dynamic-routing
was moved out of the Neutron tree there are work to add it here [1].
So until [1] is merged and hopefully backported to Queens for the latest
stable release this will work propery on RedHat based OS.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/7935/

Change-Id: Id8a97b337eff68860547e07e675b79bde94628ba
(cherry picked from commit 75a999369a7d5dc7f11680274863e3efa38e40db)

[{'created': '2018-05-21 09:44:14.000000000', 'message': 'DeployIdentifier should be provided for any parameter actions

DeployIdentifier is update during the deployment workflow in the
tripleo_common, but all the parameter update and get workflows,
before the depoloyment will fail since the parameter is not provided
for the heat stack validation. Adding a dummy entry for the DeployIdentifier
in the tripleoclient which will be replaced to a timestamp in the
deploy workflow.
Closes-Bug: #1759326

Change-Id: I26cc11895a376788d8aad41727676bec73a15d69
'}, {'created': '2018-05-24 02:20:42.000000000', 'message': 'DeployIdentifier should be provided for any parameter actions

DeployIdentifier is update during the deployment workflow in the
tripleo_common, but all the parameter update and get workflows,
before the depoloyment will fail since the parameter is not provided
for the heat stack validation. Adding a dummy entry for the DeployIdentifier
in the tripleoclient which will be replaced to a timestamp in the
deploy workflow.
Closes-Bug: #1759326

Change-Id: I26cc11895a376788d8aad41727676bec73a15d69
'}]
commit_message:
DeployIdentifier should be provided for any parameter actions

DeployIdentifier is update during the deployment workflow in the
tripleo_common, but all the parameter update and get workflows,
before the depoloyment will fail since the parameter is not provided
for the heat stack validation. Adding a dummy entry for the DeployIdentifier
in the tripleoclient which will be replaced to a timestamp in the
deploy workflow.
Closes-Bug: #1759326

Change-Id: I26cc11895a376788d8aad41727676bec73a15d69

commit_message:
Cleanup the config file on ./clean.sh

When users unstack and clean on devstack, the old config files
should be removed to avoid potential issues. As a result, users
will get a fresh new install on the next ./stack.sh

Change-Id: Ifd89dd7528d63a5e92dc9f02e939810c8fa2a247

commit_message:
integration test fixes

* updated admin user case navigation to admin - overview page on login
* updated test_update_compute_defaults making it specific to compute
* defined test_update_volume_defaults & updated defaults page module
* removed skip decorator for test_create_delete_project as bug 1777359
  is resolved
* cleaned up test_flavors and updated flavors page module

Change-Id: If529bfd7bc7fd0e29b42b12e601824ec6d684fca

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 19:34:44.000000000', 'message': "api-ref: Update notes on encryption key size

128 bit keys don't even work, and wouldn't be
recommended if they did.

Everyone should be using 256 bit keys.

Change-Id: I14c52b35abd55d0147b877b60af12c92130fa4a7
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: Update notes on encryption key size

128 bit keys don't even work, and wouldn't be
recommended if they did.

Everyone should be using 256 bit keys.

Change-Id: I14c52b35abd55d0147b877b60af12c92130fa4a7

subject: Use node.override for SSL resources
messages: [{'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2018-07-16 19:44:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2018-07-17 00:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 19:44:08.000000000', 'message': 'Use node.override for SSL resources

- HTTP is the default, but node.normal will not apply the HTTPS changes
  correctly without node.override

Change-Id: I123bb1baa37f540f908633f34693d4d7834032f1
'}]
commit_message:
Use node.override for SSL resources

- HTTP is the default, but node.normal will not apply the HTTPS changes
  correctly without node.override

Change-Id: I123bb1baa37f540f908633f34693d4d7834032f1

commit_message:
Remove hus-cmd from rootwrap volume.filters

Remove the hus-cmd and hus-cmd_local from volume.filters because
its not being used anywhere.

Change-Id: If4068378ed4804a3aa707c218f35dcd2685d06c2
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-06-27 16:37:47.000000000', 'message': "NetApp ONTAP: Remove iSCSI/FC driver online volume extend support

Cinder scheduler now checks backend capability online_extend_support
before performing an online volume extend operation. This patch makes
NetApp ONTAP iSCSI driver and FC driver report to the scheduler that
they don't support this feature, thus avoiding leaving a volume in
error_extending state after an online extending attempt.

Change-Id: Ifa248a0d3518aeffe2b6d12b064cbee9b8f48f94
Depends-On: I2c31b5c171574074a8fc7ba86f94f983fc9658f7
Related-Bug: #1765182
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Remove iSCSI/FC driver online volume extend support

Cinder scheduler now checks backend capability online_extend_support
before performing an online volume extend operation. This patch makes
NetApp ONTAP iSCSI driver and FC driver report to the scheduler that
they don't support this feature, thus avoiding leaving a volume in
error_extending state after an online extending attempt.

Change-Id: Ifa248a0d3518aeffe2b6d12b064cbee9b8f48f94
Depends-On: I2c31b5c171574074a8fc7ba86f94f983fc9658f7
Related-Bug: #1765182

subject: Remove unused commands from volume.filters

[{'created': '2018-07-07 17:51:26.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused commands from volume.filters

Most of the hitachi drivers from hbsd has been
removed from cinder. Remove them from the rootwrap
filters as well.

Change-Id: I3452d5ca94bfbc745fae86fb44513d1230717c89
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove unused commands from volume.filters

Most of the hitachi drivers from hbsd has been
removed from cinder. Remove them from the rootwrap
filters as well.

Change-Id: I3452d5ca94bfbc745fae86fb44513d1230717c89
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable split logging for cinder-glanceclient interaction

To enable split logging functionality [1], need to register
'split_loggers' conf option under [default] section of cinder.conf

This patch registers 'split_loggers' conf option under [default]
so that operator can set value of 'split_loggers' to True to
enable split logging.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/505764/

DocImpact
Change-Id: I05639133c7e5770e810be97d8c6bb98450c8c9ba

commit_message:
Replace deprecated "auth_uri" by "www_authenticate_uri"

- gate-swift-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/69/498069/1/check/gate-swift-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv/866a25c/ : SUCCESS in 18m 52s (non-voting)
- gate-swiftclient-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/69/498069/1/check/gate-swiftclient-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial/cbfb0fb/ : SUCCESS in 16m 10s
- gate-swiftclient-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/69/498069/1/check/gate-swiftclient-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv/1f8368a/ : SUCCESS in 14m 27s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 17363, 'date': '2018-04-10 23:14:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I think the side-effect of mutating headers is surprising. I would be curious if there is anyone that relies on this behavior. The patch looks great to me! :)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-12 20:28:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

So the pain was a test saying:

    meta = {'x-something-meta': 'foo'}
    c.post(blah, blah, meta)
    headers = c.head(blah, blah)
    for k, v in meta.items():
        self.assertEqual(headers[k], v)

which seems not unreasonable as long as case insensitivity or whatever.  I couldn't find any examples of httplib or urllib doing this and requests seems to avoid it as well [1] - so ... principle of least surprise may require we follow suit.

1. https://github.com/requests/requests/blob/master/requests/models.py#L433"}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-07-11 23:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

landing based on existing reviews'}, {'account_id': 27190, 'date': '2018-07-12 00:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-07-16 18:59:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Unify the Manila HA and non-HA docker configurations

Relocate the list of docker volumes and environment used by the
ManilaShare service so that a common list can be used in both HA and
non-HA deployments. For HA, the list is passed to puppet-tripleo via
hiera data.

Closes-Bug: #1749752
Depends-On: Ia81602f8a3454fcb0be2eaa9126021331d37b147
Change-Id: I66a76d3226d5a1d3e0b5387326305d1f3313a340
(cherry picked from commit 27548d4145aaa09d89979c7e0295abbb6ff2859f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 11:10:31.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie92c0edd1acb65a9a73480223b8d70ceabed18a9
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie92c0edd1acb65a9a73480223b8d70ceabed18a9

commit_message:
Fluentd:Add extra transformation for non containerized services

Containerized an non-containerized services can only be mixed
on Pike.
Currently at Pike,all the services are expected to be containerized
or non containerized but not mixed.

This patch adds an extra param so log paths are able to be
tranformed accordingly.

Added some units test

Change-Id: I3e104fbaba0b7944deccf39fd87f3efaf1e21649
Related-Bug: #1742651

Hi, Akihiro, this had been fixed in this commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574480/'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-19 02:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

zhurong, No, this is a different fix from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574480/.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574480/ fixed the failure of lower-constraints.txt job. On the other hand, this commit fixes the wrong implementation of lower-constraints job.

The current murano-dashboard lower-constraints job actually does not check lower-constraints. It works with upper-constraints because install_command refers to the upper-constraints.txt file. You will see Django 2.0.6 is used for example in your patch [1].

After this change, Django version specified in lower-constraints.txt is now used. [2]

Am I missing something?

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/80/574480/10/gate/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/018b88f/tox/lower-constraints-5.log
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/12/574512/4/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/b9bfb0b/tox/lower-constraints-5.log'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2018-06-19 03:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

due to Django version bump in upper-constraints.txt.
openstack-tox-py35 job is marked as non-voting temporarily.
Instead, horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111 is added to check
murano-dashboard with Djnago 1.11 and python3.

"}, {'created': '2018-06-19 02:43:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix lower-constraints tox env

Previously install_command specifies upper-constraints
so lower-constraints actually did not work.
upper-constraints must be specified via 'deps' instead of 'install_command'.

The fix reveals that django-formtools 1.0 is not compatible with
Django 1.11 or later. django-formtools 2.0 seems the minimum requirement.

This commit also drops Django dependency in requirements.txt.
After commit 7e91070789187d9e6b5ac2b57ca755504e058e32 in
openstack/requirements repo, all project requirements.txt must
have lower bounds and Django entry hits this.
Horizon declares django dependencies, so there is no need to
declare django dependencies in murano-dashboard explicitly.

Change-Id: I3048ca5570523494f5a58a15449902f8cb3eb3a4

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints tox env

Previously install_command specifies upper-constraints
so lower-constraints actually did not work.
upper-constraints must be specified via 'deps' instead of 'install_command'.

The fix reveals that django-formtools 1.0 is not compatible with
Django 1.11 or later. django-formtools 2.0 seems the minimum requirement.

Castellan 0.16.0 is not compatible with murano-dashboard because there is
barbican_endpoint_type. The minimum required version is 0.18.0.

This commit also drops Django dependency in requirements.txt.
After commit 7e91070789187d9e6b5ac2b57ca755504e058e32 in
openstack/requirements repo, all project requirements.txt must
have lower bounds and Django entry hits this.
Horizon declares django dependencies, so there is no need to
declare django dependencies in murano-dashboard explicitly.

Change-Id: I3048ca5570523494f5a58a15449902f8cb3eb3a4

subject: Enforce proper ordering when applying firewall rules
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-16 12:31:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-16 15:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-16 15:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-16 15:44:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nwaiting for ovb to approve'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-16 17:10:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 12:31:34.000000000', 'message': 'Enforce proper ordering when applying firewall rules

The tripleo firewall module has fundamentally three pieces:
1) firewall::pre (allows existing connections/ssh/icmp)
2) firewall::rule (allows services traffic)
3) firewall::post (drops all traffic)

One of the assumptions coded in the module is the following line:
Service<||> -> Class['tripleo::firewall::post']

Which has been added so that (see also bug LP#1643575):
"""
use ordering to make sure we start all Services in catalog before post
rules. It ensure that we don't drop all traffic before starting the
services, which could lead to services errors (e.g. trying to reach database or amqp)
"""

The problem is that there is nothing specifying that the firewall rules
created by tripleo services need to be implemented between the pre and
post classes. So the following can happen:
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 systemd: Started OpenSSH server daemon.
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Ssh::Server::Service/Service[sshd]) Triggered 'refresh' from 2 events
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:14 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created

This means that we can actually open the traffic for our services *after*
said traffic has been completely blocked. In order to fix this we
tag the pre/post rules with a different tag and add resource collectors
to actually enforce proper ordering. We now get:
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:52 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created

Tested this by doing 20 deploys of 1ctrl+1cmp and then scaling up the
overcloud to 3ctrl+2cmp.

The reason this change, besides being semantically correct, is needed
for scaling up the controller role is the following:
1) When we detect a scaleup situation, we call 'pcs cluster node add <newnode>'
   from the bootstrap node

2) It can happen that 1) succeeds because the node still had no iptables
   at all, so pcs communication succeeds. So at this point the cluster
   has added a new node and all is well

3) Now we apply the pre and post rules and all traffic is blocked. And
   slowly we start adding rules to let services be accessible over the
   network.

4) pacemaker is unable to talk to other nodes and assumes a network split.
   Eventually it will start fencing node to guarantee the state of the
   remote nodes and so the deploy will fail.

With this change if the 'pcs cluster node add' call succeeds we are
guaranteed to not interrupt network traffic afterwards.

NB: cherry-pick had a slight conflict due Ic9a2626e73d132c3be7ff14a1f4cdba0c16c5b53

Change-Id: I01e681a6305e2708bf364781a2032265b146d065
Closes-Bug: #1781147
(cherry picked from commit c525c64f6a9535b0b040cca1a7813e93dfaa797c)
'}]
commit_message:
Enforce proper ordering when applying firewall rules

The tripleo firewall module has fundamentally three pieces:
1) firewall::pre (allows existing connections/ssh/icmp)
2) firewall::rule (allows services traffic)
3) firewall::post (drops all traffic)

One of the assumptions coded in the module is the following line:
Service<||> -> Class['tripleo::firewall::post']

Which has been added so that (see also bug LP#1643575):
"""
use ordering to make sure we start all Services in catalog before post
rules. It ensure that we don't drop all traffic before starting the
services, which could lead to services errors (e.g. trying to reach database or amqp)
"""

The problem is that there is nothing specifying that the firewall rules
created by tripleo services need to be implemented between the pre and
post classes. So the following can happen:
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 systemd: Started OpenSSH server daemon.
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Ssh::Server::Service/Service[sshd]) Triggered 'refresh' from 2 events
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:14 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created

This means that we can actually open the traffic for our services *after*
said traffic has been completely blocked. In order to fix this we
tag the pre/post rules with a different tag and add resource collectors
to actually enforce proper ordering. We now get:
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:52 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created

Tested this by doing 20 deploys of 1ctrl+1cmp and then scaling up the
overcloud to 3ctrl+2cmp.

The reason this change, besides being semantically correct, is needed
for scaling up the controller role is the following:
1) When we detect a scaleup situation, we call 'pcs cluster node add <newnode>'
   from the bootstrap node

2) It can happen that 1) succeeds because the node still had no iptables
   at all, so pcs communication succeeds. So at this point the cluster
   has added a new node and all is well

3) Now we apply the pre and post rules and all traffic is blocked. And
   slowly we start adding rules to let services be accessible over the
   network.

4) pacemaker is unable to talk to other nodes and assumes a network split.
   Eventually it will start fencing node to guarantee the state of the
   remote nodes and so the deploy will fail.

With this change if the 'pcs cluster node add' call succeeds we are
guaranteed to not interrupt network traffic afterwards.

NB: cherry-pick had a slight conflict due Ic9a2626e73d132c3be7ff14a1f4cdba0c16c5b53

Change-Id: I01e681a6305e2708bf364781a2032265b146d065
Closes-Bug: #1781147
(cherry picked from commit c525c64f6a9535b0b040cca1a7813e93dfaa797c)

OvsBridge requires trust=on and promisc=on for its normal
operation. OvsUserBridge requires trust=on for its normal
operation. Also checks are added to discard any promisc
setting for OvsUserBridge.

commit_message:
Add default VF configs for ovs and ovs_user bridges

OvsBridge requires trust=on and promisc=on for its normal
operation. OvsUserBridge requires trust=on for its normal
operation. Also checks are added to discard any promisc
setting for OvsUserBridge.

Change-Id: I087ece28ea6b3101bb22bfa9b0f208df63b4fb86
Implements: blueprint sriov-vfs-as-network-interface
Signed-off-by: Karthik S <ksundara@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add sriov_vf type as member of ovs_dpdk_port

SR-IOV VF shall be bound to DPDK driver and added to
ovs_user_bridge

Implements: blueprint sriov-vfs-as-network-interface
Change-Id: Ia212ed153f4feb1e3a7fb48be95c1db63ee4b6f7

instance.live_migration_force_complete.end notifications have been
transformed to the versioned notification framework.

commit_message:
Add config overrides for systemd for better auditing

The following change will ensure that the elastic-static is logging to
the journal and that systemd is able to report how well the elastic
slice is running.

Change-Id: I79a9074b5f14a41dec421d6691fd04c0e6be15b7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2018-07-16 21:12:58.000000000', 'message': 'Remove bad utf-8 char in README.rst

This is causing the Debian package to fail to build. Please accept this

'}]
commit_message:
Remove bad utf-8 char in README.rst

This is causing the Debian package to fail to build. Please accept this
quick fix, which is replacing ":" in UTF-8 by ASCII.

Change-Id: Ibe7fce67e3b8830a11bbb90427257ae7cd4ab6d4

messages:
[{'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-06-20 19:30:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-06-21 12:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-21 13:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure we do "experimental" features in Oslo. That's why we've been so careful about working through this change as a series before landing any of it. Once the library is out there, someone is going to rely on the behavior. If we're not confident that the approach we're taking is either right or that we can modify it to be right once we release it, we should keep working on it.

When this patch lands, the code will also have landed. So, we should document things as they will be at that time, and not worry about the past or the future. The user documentation has a different audience than the spec. It should explain clearly how to use the feature, but it does not need to cover the history of its development.'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-06-22 14:10:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-06-22 14:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-06-25 08:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-06-25 08:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-06-25 08:51:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-25 19:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
User guide documentation for backend drivers for oslo.config

New documentation sections explaning how to use the backend
drivers for oslo.config, also include explanation on how to
use the remote_file driver.

Change-Id: I45fc2155f6fe2d8bee058dac880afba8bb9bfd53
Blueprint: oslo-config-drivers

commit_message:
Notify nova-api running under apache on changes

When running nova metadata api with eventlet and
nova compute api under apache wsgi config changes only
refreshes the nova-api eventlet process and not apache.

This forces a refresh of apache on nova::service::begin
anchor notifications.

Change-Id: Ie046ceca590ed7f79c3bf771cbb8f1ed88d504b4
Closes-Bug: 1658040

It looks like the requirements and constraints are out of sync. From the error log:

Validating lower constraints of requirements.txt
Package 'oslo.i18n' is constrained to 3.20.0 which does not match the minimum version specifier 3.15.3 in requirements.txt
Package 'oslo.log' is constrained to 3.37.0 which does not match the minimum version specifier 3.36.0 in requirements.txt

Package 'testtools' is constrained to 2.3.0 which does not match the minimum version specifier 2.2.0 in test-requirements.txt
Package 'coverage' is constrained to 4.5.1 which does not match the minimum version specifier 4.0 in test-requirements.txt
Package 'oslotest' is constrained to 3.3.0 which does not match the minimum version specifier 3.2.0 in test-requirements.txt
Package 'sphinx' is constrained to 1.6.5 which does not match the minimum version specifier 1.6.2 in test-requirements.txt
Package 'wsgi-intercept' is constrained to 1.6.0 which does not match the minimum version specifier 1.4.1 in test-requirements.txt
Package 'testrepository' is constrained to 0.0.20 which does not match the minimum version specifier 0.0.18 in test-requirements.txt"}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-07-12 13:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Doug: If I generate a lower-constraints.txt file with build-lower-constraints called with blazar-nova (test-)requirements, I end up with a much smaller output:

coverage!=4.4,>=4.0 # Apache-2.0
fixtures>=3.0.0 # Apache-2.0/BSD
hacking!=0.13.0,<0.14,>=0.12.0 # Apache-2.0
mock>=2.0.0 # BSD
nose>=1.3.7 # LGPL
oslo.config>=5.2.0 # Apache-2.0
oslo.i18n>=3.15.3 # Apache-2.0
oslo.log>=3.36.0 # Apache-2.0
oslotest>=3.2.0 # Apache-2.0
six>=1.10.0 # MIT
sphinx!=1.6.6,!=1.6.7,>=1.6.2 # BSD
sphinxcontrib-httpdomain>=1.3.0 # BSD
testrepository>=0.0.18 # Apache-2.0/BSD
testtools>=2.2.0 # MIT
wsgi-intercept>=1.4.1 # MIT License

Is that expected? Can we use this file as lower-constraints.txt instead?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-12 17:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> @Doug: If I generate a lower-constraints.txt file with
 > build-lower-constraints called with blazar-nova (test-)requirements,
 > I end up with a much smaller output:

build-lower-constraints does something different. It takes a set of existing lower constraints files and produces the intersection. It is meant to be used by someone who wants to find the lower constraints for several combined projects.

For you to have a valid lower constraints file in your repo, you need to include every dependency, and their dependencies, etc. Basically you need a version for everything that is installed when all of your dependencies are installed. That is going to be a bigger list than your direct dependencies.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-07-12 17:30:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > @Doug: If I generate a lower-constraints.txt file with

 > existing lower constraints files and produces the intersection. It

 > need to include every dependency, and their dependencies, etc.
 > Basically you need a version for everything that is installed when
 > all of your dependencies are installed. That is going to be a
 > bigger list than your direct dependencies.

Thanks for the explanation. What approach would you recommend here? Should we manually fix the lower-constraints.txt file to match the lower bounds in our requirements?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-12 17:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > > @Doug: If I generate a lower-constraints.txt file with
 > > > build-lower-constraints called with blazar-nova
 > (test-)requirements,
 > > > I end up with a much smaller output:
 > >
 > > build-lower-constraints does something different. It takes a set
 > of
 > > existing lower constraints files and produces the intersection.
 > It
 > > is meant to be used by someone who wants to find the lower
 > > constraints for several combined projects.
 > >
 > > For you to have a valid lower constraints file in your repo, you
 > > need to include every dependency, and their dependencies, etc.
 > > Basically you need a version for everything that is installed
 > when
 > > all of your dependencies are installed. That is going to be a
 > > bigger list than your direct dependencies.
 > 
 > Thanks for the explanation. What approach would you recommend here?
 > Should we manually fix the lower-constraints.txt file to match the
 > lower bounds in our requirements?

You could edit it by hand or try out openstack/requirements/tools/fix-lower-constraints.py to see if that gets all of them. There are directions for running the script at the top of the file.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-07-12 17:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-07-12 20:29:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-07-13 02:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I0341d09379799d37d483dfed46de9903bac77fae
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Do not use flask.g imported as g

Always explicitly use flask.g as `flask.g` and do not do `from flask
import g`.

Change-Id: I3737115717d8a5040c3e299d206fbddd43b33aa6
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Fix keystone.common.rbac_enforcer.__init__.py exporting

keystone.common.rbac_enforcer now exports (and has __all__ setup)
for the RBACEnforcer object. This limits the underlying module
knowledge needed to effectively work with the new flask RBACEnforcer.

Change-Id: I48cafa779ca1895113222a2ebfef6d738a906473
Partial-Bug: #1776504

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 15:57:24.000000000', 'message': 'Run kata-runsh on the kata runtime repo

The runtime repo is far more active than the proxy repo. We used the
proxy repo job to get the job working. Now that the job runs
successfully [0] apply it to the runtime repo so that people will see
the results and we can start to receive feedback on the setup.

[0] https://github.com/kata-containers/proxy/pull/74#issuecomment-405294886

If kata is happy with this the next step will be deploying a kata zuul
tenant.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582289/
Change-Id: I16f508bd892112f7d24d43f8f9f3952552aa7229
'}]
commit_message:
Run kata-runsh on the kata runtime repo

The runtime repo is far more active than the proxy repo. We used the
proxy repo job to get the job working. Now that the job runs
successfully [0] apply it to the runtime repo so that people will see
the results and we can start to receive feedback on the setup.

[0] https://github.com/kata-containers/proxy/pull/74#issuecomment-405294886

If kata is happy with this the next step will be deploying a kata zuul
tenant.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582289/
Change-Id: I16f508bd892112f7d24d43f8f9f3952552aa7229

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 14:06:37.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3e2b7f9990b7d1b269a75070db6c4e6b056e4df7
'}, {'created': '2018-06-11 07:09:12.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3e2b7f9990b7d1b269a75070db6c4e6b056e4df7
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3e2b7f9990b7d1b269a75070db6c4e6b056e4df7

commit_message:
Make keystone.server.flask more interesting for importing

Importing keystone.server.flask now exposes all the relevant bits
from the sub modules to develop APIs without needing to understand
all the underlying modules. __all__ has also be setup in a meaningful
way to allow for `from keystone.server.flask import *` and have
all the needed objects to start developing APIs for keystone.

Change-Id: Iab22cabb71c6690e6ffb0c9de68ed8437c4848de
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Caching of PDU autodiscovery

The caching is implemented on the get method retrieving the OID.
The actual architecture did not allow to easily have a caching on the
PDU driver instance creation since an instance of the driver is created
for *every outlet* of a given PDU

Co-Authored-By: Ilya Etingof <etingof@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id5dc17dac66d9136cf5c359dbbb55a833b1b1ad9

commit_message:
add 'patches list' command

This is a tool for listing patches associated with the goal based on
the team, so we can tell when all of the changes have merged and it is
safe to update the project-config settings.

Change-Id: I7d99fd6786d34ee728cf4481f3f36c1fc52562c6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 16:24:20.000000000', 'message': "Correct log warning for unknown lvalue

The default systemd service template was using the PrivateUsers
directive by default which was only implemented in systemd version 232.
Because we're running on older versions of systemd in a lot of cases the
this option was creating a log of journal spam. To correct the issue the
version of systemd is now detected and this default option will only be
used when the version of systemd is greater than or equal to version
232.

Change-Id: Ief1a2e155892ab7df821fbf049787e705da91b40
Closes-Bug: #1776818
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Correct log warning for unknown lvalue

The default systemd service template was using the PrivateUsers
directive by default which was only implemented in systemd version 232.
Because we're running on older versions of systemd in a lot of cases the
this option was creating a log of journal spam. To correct the issue the
version of systemd is now detected and this default option will only be
used when the version of systemd is greater than or equal to version
232.

Change-Id: Ief1a2e155892ab7df821fbf049787e705da91b40
Closes-Bug: #1776818
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Migrate to override_role for compute module (part 3)

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the compute module. This
PS handles the last 11 modules for compute.

This PS also removes unnecessary indexing into response bodies.

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: Ie3c2982bad2c2cdfebb6880001d90a6145732eec

commit_message:
Migrate to override_role for compute module (part 3)

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the compute module. This
PS handles the last 11 modules for compute.

This PS also removes unnecessary indexing into response bodies.

[0] I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I15200bde8e509bc9b18fd4a843b11c7a02e0c374

'}, {'created': '2018-07-03 03:10:04.000000000', 'message': 'Flesh out and add testing for flask_RESTful scaffolding

Add in support for JSON Home documents, a ResourceBase implementing

commit_message:
Flesh out and add testing for flask_RESTful scaffolding

Add in support for JSON Home documents, a ResourceBase implementing
basic functionality, and full testing of the new flask_RESTful
scaffolding.

Change-Id: I5bcc8660b68c0b39a2110089f6c67531769d14ef
Parital-Bug: #1776504

I think we at least need to remove .testr.conf. Hoping mtrienish has a chance to take a look over too as he had a lot of good guidance on other ones like this.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-05-10 14:36:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Yeah, Sean is correct we should probably just switch to stestr directly here. It's the PTI: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/pti/python.html#python-test-running we want to get all projects on the same basic thing. But it also gives you some more flexibility.

I also left some inline comments about not using an env variable for discovery path. As for removing the .testr.conf, it doesn't really matter from my POV. Normally I just delete it to keep things clean, since it won't be used anymore. But, it doesn't do anything just sitting there."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-04 20:30:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to conform to the PTI

The current Python Testing Interface specifies the use of
stester, so update tox.ini to use it.

Closes-bug: #1780272
Change-Id: I6b6c60486a26cfbb5793c074fe6f554c6a324846
Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>

commit_message:
use upstream git url instead of github

* It changes the git url of python-tempestconf and tempest
  and list files to make sure directory get clonned.

Change-Id: I82ea378ac5da93e65db44613404965566903a89f

subject: Update Gemfile for Zuulv3
messages: [{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-07-12 08:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-07-16 20:37:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nMonty reviewed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582025/1/Gemfile and I'm using that review as a standin for reviews on the same update to other Gemfiles. Mass approving with this in mind."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 08:04:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update Gemfile for Zuulv3

The logic in the Gemfile was relying on Zuulv2 variables to find out
whether the spec helper gem was already available on disk, and since
Zuulv3 has changed things it was failing to find it and downloading the
master version instead. This patch ensures the Gemfile looks for the gem
in the right place when running in CI.

Change-Id: Ib6b780ed33fa65694ca3471a7bcf19e7730c18a9
'}]
commit_message:
Update Gemfile for Zuulv3

The logic in the Gemfile was relying on Zuulv2 variables to find out
whether the spec helper gem was already available on disk, and since
Zuulv3 has changed things it was failing to find it and downloading the
master version instead. This patch ensures the Gemfile looks for the gem
in the right place when running in CI.

Change-Id: Ib6b780ed33fa65694ca3471a7bcf19e7730c18a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 09:50:58.000000000', 'message': "Enable multi store support for glance

Added supporting logic to configure, manage and use multiple stores
of the same or different type/scheme. Added new config option
'default_backend' which will be used to specifiy default store
to which image will be stored.

Added support for file and rbd store. The default behavior is
maintained for backward compatibility.

DocImpact
Partial-Implements: bp multi-store

commit_message:
Enable multi store support for glance

Added supporting logic to configure, manage and use multiple stores
of the same or different type/scheme. Added new config option
'default_backend' which will be used to specifiy default store
to which image will be stored.

Added support for file and rbd store. The default behavior is
maintained for backward compatibility.

DocImpact
Partial-Implements: bp multi-store

Change-Id: I1f2e8fa61d6dfecd8395a1f894f74ec5bcb5573c

commit_message:
Transform instance.live_migration_post notification

The instance.live_migration_post.start and
instance.live_migration_post.end notifications have been transformed to
the versioned notification framework.

Co-Authored-By: Alex Szarka <szarka@inf.u-szeged.hu>
Co-Authored-By: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: If9993d5edab5a2f141387a8eb294a9645667ee6b
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-rocky

commit_message:
Transform instance.live_migration_rollback_dest notification

The instance.live_migration_rollback_dest.start and
instance.live_migration_rollback_dest.end notifications has been
transformed to the versioned notification framework.

Co-Authored-By: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I8129cbd1785133d4cc1b70bbba6bd7fcc1d21f4a
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-rocky

 > > conductor (for move operations) -> finally the API changes to
 > turn
 > > it all on.
 > 
 > @Matt: which API change do you refer to? I don't see any REST API
 > change in this spec.
 > 
 > This LGTM! (but needs a rebase)

Yeah, I'm not actually doing anything with the values returned here so nothing will get switched on until I start doing that (which is the last thing in the series)."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-08 17:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2018-04-26 10:23:51.000000000', 'message': "network: Add '_get_network_tunnel_status'

This determines whether the network is an L3 tunnel provider network and
allows us to populate the appropriate attribute on the NetworkRequest
object.

With this complete, we complete step two of four for the blueprint.

  [*] Identify and store affinity of networks to host NUMA nodes
  [*] Store additional information about networks requested at instance
      creation
  [ ] Utilize information about host network affinity and instance
      network requests during claims
  [ ] Utilize information about host network affinity and instance
      network requests during scheduling

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I535a64ab16abc9a7d34220fcc3dba36a4d663bfe

commit_message:
network: Retrieve tunneled status in '_get_physnet_info'

This determines whether the network is an L3 tunnel provider network and
allows us to populate the appropriate attribute on the 'NetworkMetadata'
object returned by the function. This requires renaming the function to
represent its new purpose.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I535a64ab16abc9a7d34220fcc3dba36a4d663bfe

$ grep -r is_scheduler_filter_enabled *
tempest/scenario/test_security_groups_basic_ops.py:            compute.is_scheduler_filter_enabled("DifferentHostFilter")
tempest/api/compute/servers/test_server_group.py:        compute.is_scheduler_filter_enabled("ServerGroupAffinityFilter"),
tempest/api/compute/admin/test_live_migration.py:        compute.is_scheduler_filter_enabled("DifferentHostFilter"),

tempest/api/compute/admin/test_servers_on_multinodes.py:        compute.is_scheduler_filter_enabled("ServerGroupAffinityFilter"),
tempest/common/compute.py:def is_scheduler_filter_enabled(filter_name):

The ServerGroupAffinity filters have been in the nova defaults since icehouse AFAICT, so just the Same/DifferentHostFilter checks would be affected.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-20 15:49:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

ServerGroup(Anti)AffinityFilter are in the nova defaults, so they're fine, but probably a good idea for the ones, indeed."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-20 19:54:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-20 19:55:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-25 08:38:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Possibly another way would be to make the tempest default list to match the nova default list of filters.

But I'm fine with this way too, seems reasonable"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2018-05-22 12:16:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

It looks really ugly, some cases you respect an option behavior some cases you want to be explicit.

I would suggest to

1. convince devstack to use the proper $FILTER option in the  scheduler_available_filters tempest option.  # just to make sure we do not skip something if tempest changes defaults

2. make the tempest default the same as the current nova default.

However we  prefer to enable everything by default, the `all` handling is there everywhere, it might not be the best solution either.

We might consider also using !filter_name style options, where people can make all,!but_this_filter kind of options.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-05-23 14:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> 1. convince devstack to use the proper $FILTER option in the 
> scheduler_available_filters tempest option.  # just to make sure we
> do not skip something if tempest changes defaults

Done: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570205/

> 2. make the tempest default the same as the current nova default.

Done: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570207/'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-07-16 20:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add explicit scheduler filter check

is_scheduler_filter_enabled checks if the given filter is listed in
CONF.compute_feature_enabled.scheduler_available_filters. That option
has a special 'all' value that is understood to mean 'all filters are
enabled' by various tempest tests. However, what it really means is
'the default nova filters are enabled.' This was reported as bug
1628443, which was fixed by changing the help text to clarify the
meaning of 'all'. However, tests that rely on non-default nova filters
will still fail if scheduler_available_filters is set to 'all' but
their needed filter isn't actually enabled. This patch adds a
trust_defaults parameter to is_scheduler_filter_enabled. If set to
True, is_scheduler_filter_enabled will not rely on the nova defaults
and will only return True if the given filter is explicitly mentioned
in scheduler_available_filters.

Related-bug: 1628443
Change-Id: I2e433670721a8832d43b5dd2a3dfa998972f6e41

commit_message:
Do not use SameHostFilter in API sample tests

The same_host scheduler hint takes a UUID, not a regex. This went
unnoticed because SameHostFilter isn't actually enabled in any API
samples tests. This patch just removes any uses of it.

Change-Id: I8da7258c77b385ccc1362df7f4e0d320ab64786a

commit_message:
Split Kubernetes install from Mulinode guide

Splits the OSH AIO gate script-based installation guide out of the main
multinode guide, and adds context to the multinode guide around
using a prod-grade k8s installer or the gate scripts as appropriate.

Change-Id: I9fa9d498e49efc1867c8f347fd3c814263c23717
Story: 2002526
Task: 22200

subject: Add two fields to NeutronDbObjectDuplicateEntry
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5367, 'name': 'boden', 'email': 'bodenvmw@gmail.com', 'username': 'boden'}, {'_account_id': 7715, 'name': 'Hirofumi Ichihara', 'email': 'ichihara.hirofumi@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hirofumi-Ichihara'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27546, 'name': 'Michal Kelner Mishali', 'email': 'mkelnermishal@vmware.com', 'username': 'mkelnermishal'}, {'_account_id': 27654, 'name': 'Hongbin Lu', 'email': 'kira034@163.com', 'username': 'hongbin.lu'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-06-08 22:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27546, 'date': '2018-06-11 06:24:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-06-13 18:55:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Can you give an example of the before/after if you have one?  I just don't know enough about this to give more than my commit message nit."}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-06-14 13:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Can you please add a release note since this is adding to the public API.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-06-22 17:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Can you give an example of the before/after if you have one?  I
 > just don't know enough about this to give more than my commit
 > message nit.

Here is an example [1]. Without this change, the original code is:

        try:
            with db_api.context_manager.writer.using(context):
                ...
                pf_obj.create()
        except obj_exc.NeutronDbObjectDuplicateEntry:
            (__, conflict_params) = self.try_find_exist(context, floatingip_id,
                                                        port_forwarding)
            message = _("Duplicate portforwarding, a port forwarding with "
                        "same attributes already exists, conflict params like "
                        "%s") % conflict_params
            raise lib_exc.BadRequest(resource=apidef.RESOURCE_NAME,
                                     msg=message)

    def try_find_exist(self, context, floatingip_id, port_forwarding,
                       specify_params=None):
        if not specify_params:
            params = [{'floating_ip_id': floatingip_id,
                       'external_port': port_forwarding['external_port']},
                      {'internal_port_id': port_forwarding['internal_port_id'],
                       'internal_ip_address': port_forwarding[
                           'internal_ip_address'],
                       'internal_port': port_forwarding['internal_port']}]
        else:
            params = specify_params
        for param in params:
            objs = pf.PortForwarding.get_objects(context, **param)
            if objs:
                return (objs[0], param)

With this change, the code can be:

        try:
            with db_api.context_manager.writer.using(context):
                ...
                pf_obj.create()
        except obj_exc.NeutronDbObjectDuplicateEntry as e:
            message = _("Duplicate portforwarding, a port forwarding with "
                        "same attributes already exists, conflict params like "
                        "%s") % e.columns
            raise lib_exc.BadRequest(resource=apidef.RESOURCE_NAME,
                                     msg=message)

commit_message:
Add two fields to NeutronDbObjectDuplicateEntry

When people were handling duplicated entry error from DB, sometimes
they were trying to find out the specific columns where the value is
duplicated. However, such information are not in the exception object
which is inconvenient. People were even trying to do another query to
find out the duplicated columns. This patch addresses it.

Change-Id: If3ebcdfb5c3a5ddba1e2ebb6cb0ff79239e1ccd3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 20:09:04.000000000', 'message': "Migrate ironic `snmp` driver to the latest pysnmp API

Since pysnmp 4.3 (which dates back to 2015), library's high-level
SNMP API has been reworked towards better consistency and performance.
Ironic snmp driver still uses the older pysnmp API. This story
suggests migrating ironic snmp driver to the latest (e.g.
post 4.3) pysnmp API.

This bumps up ironic lower constraint on pysnmp.

Change-Id: Id3a03210e8a52dda5e6403e2f9cb040c59ca9573
Story: 2002756
Task: 22612

commit_message:
Migrate ironic `snmp` driver to the latest pysnmp API

Since pysnmp 4.3 (which dates back to 2015), library's high-level
SNMP API has been reworked towards better consistency and performance.
Ironic snmp driver still uses the older pysnmp API. This story
suggests migrating ironic snmp driver to the latest (e.g.
post 4.3) pysnmp API.

This bumps up ironic lower constraint on pysnmp.

Change-Id: Id3a03210e8a52dda5e6403e2f9cb040c59ca9573
Story: 2002756
Task: 22612

(7 comments)

There is one major concern I have about this specific implementation proposal and at least I did not come up with obvious solution.

How do we handle upgrade/migrations between configs. Say operator wants to start using multiple stores instead of their current model and moves from using rbd store to using rbd:ssd and rbd:spindle stores. What needs to be taken into account in this model as we do not have any of that metadata tracked in our current locations model. Obviously we could do some kind of mapping between the location uri and config to expose the information at which named store (or store id) the image most likely falls and compose that in flight. We would need to look into performance side how feasible this is for example while listing tens of thousands of images.

Few other comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-04-26 13:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(7 comments)

> (7 comments)
 > 
 > There is one major concern I have about this specific
 > implementation proposal and at least I did not come up with obvious
 > solution.
 > 
 > How do we handle upgrade/migrations between configs. Say operator
 > wants to start using multiple stores instead of their current model
 > and moves from using rbd store to using rbd:ssd and rbd:spindle
 > stores. What needs to be taken into account in this model as we do
 > not have any of that metadata tracked in our current locations
 > model. Obviously we could do some kind of mapping between the
 > location uri and config to expose the information at which named
 > store (or store id) the image most likely falls and compose that in
 > flight. We would need to look into performance side how feasible
 > this is for example while listing tens of thousands of images.
 > 
 So here you mean to say if existing single rbd store is configured and then we shift to muti store with rbd:ssd or rbd:spindle. In this case with current design user needs to set default store to the old rdb (now termed as ceph1) and can add new stores with rbd:ssd (ceph2) and rbd:spindle (ceph3). By default if he tries to download any image it will look in old rbd store (ceph1), or if he changes default store to ceph2 or ceph3 then he needs to pass a header in request with ceph1 to download images from old store, same case is for upload. 


Few other comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-04-26 13:22:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Keycloak and Docker

* Added Keycloak to the infrastructure yaml which uses a h2 not to complicate the installation.
* Updated the docker-compose docs.
* Moved CloudFlow to the infrastructure yaml.

Change-Id: I00dd9e236c8132d6d1682bf0b217ab7d216e4a7d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 12:29:48.000000000', 'message': "Windows SMBFS: avoid mounting local shares by default

In quite a few situations, SMB shares exposed by the local server
cannot be mounted locally (e.g. SoFS shares).

The Nova Hyper-V driver will always pass the 'local_path_for_loopback'
flag to the os-brick connector, but this doesn't happen when Cinder
connects to volumes exposed by the SMB driver. For this reason,
cinder will fail to backup volumes residing on SoFS shares.

To keep it simple, we can just change the default behavior of the SMB
os-brick connector so that local shares are never mounted, using the
shared path directly.

Change-Id: Id5beadce70532fb6b0e56e40fce1f62e6eaa3877
Related-Bug: #1781205
"}]
commit_message:
Windows SMBFS: avoid mounting local shares by default

In quite a few situations, SMB shares exposed by the local server
cannot be mounted locally (e.g. SoFS shares).

The Nova Hyper-V driver will always pass the 'local_path_for_loopback'
flag to the os-brick connector, but this doesn't happen when Cinder
connects to volumes exposed by the SMB driver. For this reason,
cinder will fail to backup volumes residing on SoFS shares.

To keep it simple, we can just change the default behavior of the SMB
os-brick connector so that local shares are never mounted, using the
shared path directly.

Change-Id: Id5beadce70532fb6b0e56e40fce1f62e6eaa3877
Related-Bug: #1781205

commit_message:
update data structures in place

Rather than building new data structures, update the in-tree structure
in place. This results in more formatting and comments being retained
than might otherwise.

Change-Id: Ibe741d43e9787a3369670e9f84c9d4eb5dde76ec
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
