[{'created': '2018-06-29 13:28:37.000000000', 'message': "Replace 'raise StopIteration' with 'return'

With PEP 479, the behaviour of StopIteration is changing. Raising it to
stop a generator is considered incorrect and from Python 3.7 this will
cause a RuntimeError. The PEP recommends using the return statement.

More details: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0479/#examples-of-breakage

Change-Id: If53f0f4c313a699a4036838ab6035fffa931931b
"}]
commit_message:
Replace 'raise StopIteration' with 'return'

With PEP 479, the behaviour of StopIteration is changing. Raising it to
stop a generator is considered incorrect and from Python 3.7 this will
cause a RuntimeError. The PEP recommends using the return statement.

More details: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0479/#examples-of-breakage

Change-Id: If53f0f4c313a699a4036838ab6035fffa931931b

commit_message:
move control of jobs to os-vif

- This change removes the triggering of the
  legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif job against os-vif
  form project-config in favor of managing jobs in repo.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559401/
Change-Id: Ic9fdd069bd507e07423821cbcf8249f40ace1a97

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

Change-Id: Idbaea26c49ae3ee447092bdbc14b849bb5261e23

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 19:45:07.000000000', 'message': 'docs: Uplift overview.rst with additional info from README

This patchset uplifts the overview documentation page with
information that is also contained in the README page; ideally
both pages should be the same.

This also adds a Terminology subsection underneath the
"How it works" section which expands on essential terminology
needed to understand Patrole testing architecture:

* Expected Result - The expected result of a given test.
* Actual Result - The actual result of a given test.
* Final Result - A match between both expected and actual results. A mismatch
  in the expected result and the actual result will result in a test failure.

  * Expected: Pass | Actual: Pass - Test Case Success
  * Expected: Pass | Actual: Fail - Test Case Failure
  * Expected: Fail | Actual: Pass - Test Case Failure
  * Expected: Fail | Actual: Fail (Expected exception) - Test Case Success
  * Expected: Fail | Actual: Fail (Unexpected exception) - Test Case Failure

Change-Id: I1d640200c55ce26cfd38197ec6face1161217b17

commit_message:
docs: Add symlink to readme from overview documentation

This patchset brings the README.rst and the overview.rst
documentation together. Previously they were maintained
separately which causes maintenance issues. This adds
a symlink from the overview.rst to the README.rst so
that the overview documentation only needs to be maintained
for the README.

This also adds a Terminology subsection underneath the
"How it works" section which expands on essential terminology
needed to understand Patrole testing architecture:

* Expected Result - The expected result of a given test.
* Actual Result - The actual result of a given test.
* Final Result - A match between both expected and actual results. A mismatch
  in the expected result and the actual result will result in a test failure.

  * Expected: Pass | Actual: Pass - Test Case Success
  * Expected: Pass | Actual: Fail - Test Case Failure
  * Expected: Fail | Actual: Pass - Test Case Failure
  * Expected: Fail | Actual: Fail (Expected exception) - Test Case Success
  * Expected: Fail | Actual: Fail (Unexpected exception) - Test Case Failure

Change-Id: I1d640200c55ce26cfd38197ec6face1161217b17

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 06:34:32.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I164e60e6310fb0f899973ac2460b213c6c7cb5f5
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I164e60e6310fb0f899973ac2460b213c6c7cb5f5

commit_message:
Fix broken tests due to oslo.policy 1.38.0

Fixed broken unit tests of task api. The reason for failure is
new version of oslo.poliyc requires dict or context object but
some of the tests are passing a mock object.

Mocked the enforce method of glance policy to avoid the failures.

Change-Id: Ie42dbe16137fba9b32c9169c85db59fd94da1c76
Closes-Bug: #1781976

commit_message:
Revert "Use os.mkdir instead of mkdir"

This reverts commit fc3f5d8e8d38831b8b6f3c60fad40243eda22c8b.

The use of os.mkdir does not cover the substituted mkdir -p calls, see
bug #1780750 .

Change-Id: I8f5fc8ee22fdacd732b769c2d6d688c3dd0bdb81

commit_message:
Add complete lifecycle to API doc

Complete lifecycle API was implemented as part of lifecycle hook
implementation in [1]. This commit updates the API doc to include the
new complete lifecycle API.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/senlin/commit/3dd9f3ecde0fad9e76de5b1aa238a14dcfa52f67

subject: Reenable packethost in nodepool
messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-07-16 15:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-07-16 15:39:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nI'm cool with this, though could also see ramping usage back up more slowly in case the MTU-related issues were masking other problems we don't know about yet."}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-07-16 15:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-07-16 15:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-16 16:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 15:35:31.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Disable packethost to debug possible MTU issues"

This reverts commit 9cd1fdf78b95146da2d036899976fcc887e777da.

Packethost instances have an mtu of 1500 now and we've tried to address
the small mtu problem in devstack gate and zuul jobs for multinode
network overlays.

Change-Id: I52a73f039f4fe074042e367fa0262f0ce3715725
'}, {'created': '2018-07-16 15:50:54.000000000', 'message': "Reenable packethost in nodepool

Packethost instances have an mtu of 1500 now and we've tried to address
the small mtu problem in devstack gate and zuul jobs for multinode
network overlays. We should be good to start a small number of instances
in packethost to see that everything is working against before bumping
this number up to 100.

Change-Id: I52a73f039f4fe074042e367fa0262f0ce3715725
"}]
commit_message:
Reenable packethost in nodepool

Packethost instances have an mtu of 1500 now and we've tried to address
the small mtu problem in devstack gate and zuul jobs for multinode
network overlays. We should be good to start a small number of instances
in packethost to see that everything is working against before bumping
this number up to 100.

Change-Id: I52a73f039f4fe074042e367fa0262f0ce3715725

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 15:03:20.000000000', 'message': 'Remove table 17 from OVS OF pipeline sync

OpenFlow flows for table 17 now only appear after a port is created and
there is no longer a default flow during the deploy stage. Therefore
remove the check for table 17 existing during deployment.

Closes-Bug: 1781616

Change-Id: Ie988ba6a2d444a614e97c0edf5fce24b23970310
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove table 17 from OVS OF pipeline sync

OpenFlow flows for table 17 now only appear after a port is created and
there is no longer a default flow during the deploy stage. Therefore
remove the check for table 17 existing during deployment.

Closes-Bug: 1781616

Change-Id: Ie988ba6a2d444a614e97c0edf5fce24b23970310
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

do you want to continue on this - or abandon this and the project-config?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-06-11 12:08:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

sorry i have not had time to work on this lately.
i would prefer to contiue working on this however i also realised that i cannot follow the normal workflow described here https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#moving-legacy-jobs-to-projects

as this is a shared job that both nova and os-vif use so we cant delete this form the project-config repo until we also move a copy of this job into the nova repo also.

so if this series is not fully following the https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#moving-legacy-jobs-to-projects process that is why.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-06-11 12:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

commit_message:
move legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif to repo

- This change ports the legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif
  job to be in repo as os-vif-ovs.
- The os-vif-ovs will be converted
  to use the non legacy workflow in a follow up commit.
- This change adds os-vif-ovs
  to the gate and check pipelines.
- legacy-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif will be removed
  form the os-vif jobs in project-config in a follow up
  commit.

Change-Id: Ida41a4ec5602482406c7401621498deeee9f1b8b

commit_message:
Move scenario009 to the check queue

This scenario tests OpenShift deployment managed by TripleO on BM
nodes. We got the job working last week and it's been working fine
since then.

 Let's move it to the check queue as a non-voting job for now and,
eventually, make it voting.

Change-Id: Ief28df449e1e37fb9c73ecaf839d3e335abb3ed8

commit_message:
Update rdocloud env: boot_from_volume not required

Since Instance ephemeral storage is SSD now in RDO Cloud
General Aggregate, boot_from_volume is not required.
boot_from_volume can still be used when required.

Also add reference for queens image.

Change-Id: Ibfd51c242586102b0163643e772163a7ac924105

network topology highlighting work

subject: Warn when some network resources are not available
messages:
[{'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-18 11:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-20 13:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8351, 'date': '2018-06-20 21:05:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I have network isolation unselected and can see the network topology still, but don't see anything highlighted or any notifications. Would you mind sharing any configuration changes that will make this happen? Or a screenshot of how it looks with your environment?"}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-21 12:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is the result when network isolation environment is not enabled. https://ibb.co/ikXRzo

It is possible that your setup uses custom network-environment.yaml try to disable user-environment.yaml too.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-21 12:55:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8351, 'date': '2018-06-21 17:41:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This is great. It ties the message to the disabled networks visually. A few comments:

- Does it make sense to bury the information about resource definition from the user and say something more generic like "Some networks are unavailable. Enable network isolation to make use of these networks."

- This will be even nicer when we pull the network configuration settings into this modal in another tab, but what about making the "Enable Network Isolation" piece of the message be a link that takes the user to the network tab of the config modal? 

- I noticed that the overflow:scroll is not inline with the other patches and causes some issues with scrolling and closing the modal. Not sure if it's something that matters since other patches handle that well, but figured it's worth a mention!'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-21 19:17:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> This is great. It ties the message to the disabled networks
 > visually. A few comments:
 > 
 > - Does it make sense to bury the information about resource
 > definition from the user and say something more generic like "Some
 > networks are unavailable. Enable network isolation to make use of
 > these networks."
Done
 > 
 > - This will be even nicer when we pull the network configuration
 > settings into this modal in another tab, but what about making the
 > "Enable Network Isolation" piece of the message be a link that
 > takes the user to the network tab of the config modal?
 > 
Done (link points to deployment configuration which is how precisely we can currently link right now)

 > - I noticed that the overflow:scroll is not inline with the other
 > patches and causes some issues with scrolling and closing the
 > modal. Not sure if it's something that matters since other patches
 > handle that well, but figured it's worth a mention!
Done'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-21 19:17:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:08:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-07-13 09:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-07-16 12:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Warn when some network resources are not available

In case when network-isolation is not enabled, network topology diagram
shows networks-roles assigment as usual but hightlights networks which
don't have corresponding Heat resource defined. Notification about network
isolation is desplayed to the user.

Implements: blueprint networks-crud-ui
Change-Id: Id4b8e3e1c4b8a7de9e463230d822bbbb0afb321c

This looks good. Should we consider a fixed width? Scrolling? Something akin to google maps?'}, {'account_id': 8351, 'date': '2018-05-29 20:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> This looks good. Should we consider a fixed width? Scrolling?
 > Something akin to google maps?

Great question! I think for the initial implementation we should rely on scrolling for any large scale topologies. It would be nice to get fancier with resizing in the future though. I plan to come up with some designs around a "large scale" example and we can talk through a strategy as a team.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-07 13:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> > This looks good. Should we consider a fixed width? Scrolling?
 > > Something akin to google maps?
 > 
 > Great question! I think for the initial implementation we should
 > rely on scrolling for any large scale topologies. It would be nice
 > to get fancier with resizing in the future though. I plan to come
 > up with some designs around a "large scale" example and we can talk
 > through a strategy as a team.

I am working further on this, my goal is to force the role cards to stay in line and introduce horizontal scrolling when they overflow. The modal panel and middle networks column makes it a bit challenging'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-13 10:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-14 17:52:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-15 12:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-18 11:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-20 13:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 8351, 'date': '2018-06-20 14:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

I think the scrolling works well as a starting point for supporting any overflow. Also, I really like the way it loads with animation showing the connections. Well done with all of this :)

A few nits:
- Can we bold the Network name?
- I think we should remove the color stripe at the top of the role cards. Reducing any color use where possible will help let the Network colors and connections hold their relationship.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-06-21 12:55:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 8351, 'date': '2018-06-21 17:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10112, 'date': '2018-07-06 15:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2018-07-12 13:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-07-13 09:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16: Patch Set 15 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-07-16 12:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add Network Topology diagram

Network topology diagram lists roles and networks and draws connections
based on networks-roles assignment. Each Network includes VLAN ID and
IP subnet information.

Implements: blueprint networks-crud-ui
Co-Authored-By: Honza Pokorny <honza@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I16f48e7d52d8c96c1bcbb7a0d28553500334c10d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 11:18:51.000000000', 'message': "OVN: Add env file to enable dhcp agent for SRIOV deployments

In the case of OVN, ovn-controller service responds to the DHCP requests from the VMs.
But in the case of SRIOV VMs, ovn-controller won't be able to capture the traffic sent
via sriov directly to the switch.

So this patch adds an environment variable to enable dhcp agent. It is expected to
include the environment file - environments/services/neutron-ovn-sriov.yaml
after including the main OVN environment file. The main OVN environment files
(neutron-ovn-ha.yaml, neutron-ovn-dvr-ha.yaml) disables  all the neutron agent
services.

Change-Id: Id6a0ce90fdc7348f47e239ec929bf88ca35c5fab
Closes-bug: #1779106
"}, {'created': '2018-07-03 09:17:35.000000000', 'message': "OVN: Add env file to deploy SRIOV with OVN.

commit_message:
OVN: Add env file to deploy SRIOV with OVN.

This patch adds an environment file to enable sriov agent with OVN. It is expected to
include the environment file - environments/services/neutron-ovn-sriov.yaml
after including the main OVN environment file. The main OVN environment files
(neutron-ovn-ha.yaml, neutron-ovn-dvr-ha.yaml) disables  all the neutron agent
services.

ovn-controller service responds to the DHCP requests from the VMs.
But in the case of SRIOV VMs, ovn-controller won't be able to capture the traffic sent
via SRIOV directly to the switch. So neutron-ovn-sriov.yaml enables dhcp agent.

Change-Id: Id6a0ce90fdc7348f47e239ec929bf88ca35c5fab
Closes-bug: #1779106

Add tempest container to docker.yaml

* it will help to update the tempest container and reuse it in CI
  when it is gated against a changeset.

commit_message:
Add memory and swap info into collect-logs collect task

This adds collection of /proc/meminfo and swaps into the
collect-logs task in addition to the existing /proc/cpuinfo

Change-Id: Ibe4b95505ca8a53e8db33a003799f6cfcec942bb

commit_message:
Update attach_volume and detach_volume policy rules

The prior commit for this was functional but not quite
correct. The policy rules currently in Horizon for
attach and detach of volumes don't exist in Nova and
are missing from the local copy of nova_policy.json and
from Nova generated policy files. The fix to use the
create instance copy of the rule only worked for attach
and not detach ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570071/ )

This commit updates detach as well, and should be correct
going forward based on the Nova policy rules at:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/policies/volumes_attachments.py

Change-Id: I07fccd6f12149cd88a049c46aa113dfd2b60bbaa
Closes-bug: 1772759
(cherry picked from commit b9a1c445d9c357967ea2ee7152651131118a135d)

LGMT'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-10 23:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

It looks good to add the missing policy rule to match the policies from backend services,  On the other hand, from the stable branch point of view, we should not drop the existing policy rule because no existing deployment should be affected by a stable backport. If there are deployers who already have configured the rules dropped by this patch, the backport will break them.

My suggestion is to keep the existing rules and add the missing rules (using OR operator). In addition, a release note would be nice.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-06-11 09:29:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

I'll keep my vote until Akihiro's comments will be addressed"}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-06-11 18:14:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

thank you for the review, I'm a little confused looking at the policy code though:
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/horizon/base.py#L163  seems to indicate that the rules are OR'd
while https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_auth/policy.py#L78  implies an AND relationship. 

Most policy checks seem to be based on a single rule, though I found the occasional exception... guess I should just test it out"}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-06-11 22:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'll need to read up more to understand the options better, changing:
policy.check((("compute","os_compute_api:os-volumes-attachments:delete"),),
to 
policy.check((
("compute","os_compute_api:os-volumes-attachments:delete"),
("compute","os_compute_api:servers:detach_volume"),),

doesn't work... so odds are my syntax is wrong with that...'}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-07-16 17:24:56.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

not clear on ORing two rules with 'paths' (the ops_compute_api:... rather than more typical rules from OR expressions which contain no : )... anyway, leaving queens as-is for now"}]

commit_message:
Update attach_volume and detach_volume policy rules

The prior commit for this was functional but not quite
correct. The policy rules currently in Horizon for
attach and detach of volumes don't exist in Nova and
are missing from the local copy of nova_policy.json and
from Nova generated policy files. The fix to use the
create instance copy of the rule only worked for attach
and not detach ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570071/ )

This commit updates detach as well, and should be correct
going forward based on the Nova policy rules at:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/policies/volumes_attachments.py

Change-Id: I07fccd6f12149cd88a049c46aa113dfd2b60bbaa

commit_message:
Enable proxy header parsing

Ensure that oslo.middleware parses any proxy information
forwarded from haproxy/apache with regards to protocol;
this ensures that https connections are correctly detected.

Includes charm helper sync to bring in oslo middleware
template.

Change-Id: Icf13afd3a669d08a3254a362373ea7eeeb0d41f9
Closes-Bug: 1758675
(cherry picked from commit 432b83ae5dd461da542642043fa56a0c0261bad1)

...

Does it mean the tests should be restarted?'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-07-04 14:44:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Looks like a test infra problem to me:

Machine  State  DNS  Inst id  Series  AZ  Message
6        down        pending  trusty      no "trusty" images in serverstack with arches [amd64 arm64 ppc64el s390x]

I will ping somebody to check.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-07-04 16:56:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I confirmed that images are indeed not present. I'll do a rerun once this gets fixed."}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-07-05 13:51:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-07-05 19:49:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-07-06 07:11:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

DEBUG:runner:Traceback (most recent call last):
DEBUG:runner:  File "/tmp/bundletester-HK5f9W/neutron-openvswitch/tests/gate-basic-xenial-pike", line 26, in <module>
DEBUG:runner:    deployment.run_tests()
DEBUG:runner:  File "/tmp/bundletester-HK5f9W/neutron-openvswitch/tests/charmhelpers/contrib/amulet/deployment.py", line 99, in run_tests
DEBUG:runner:    getattr(self, test)()
DEBUG:runner:  File "/tmp/bundletester-HK5f9W/neutron-openvswitch/tests/basic_deployment.py", line 371, in test_400_enable_qos
DEBUG:runner:    extensions = config.get('agent', 'extensions').split(',')
DEBUG:runner:  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/ConfigParser.py", line 618, in get
DEBUG:runner:    raise NoOptionError(option, section)
DEBUG:runner:ConfigParser.NoOptionError: No option 'extensions' in section: 'agent'
DEBUG:runner:Exit Code: 1

The failure doesn't seem to be related to this.

templates/mitaka/openvswitch_agent.ini has a conditional extensions section.

{% if extension_drivers -%}
extensions = {{ extension_drivers }}

enable_qos is the only option in this case that can affect it and it is set to False in neutron-api by default.


In the test_400_enable_qos the enable-qos config option is alternated on neutron-api, however, there are no checks for exceptions when openvswitch_agent.ini is loaded:

+            config = u._get_config(
+                unit,
+                '/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/openvswitch_agent.ini')
+            extensions = config.get('agent', 'extensions').split(',')
+            if 'qos' not in extensions:
+                message = "qos not in extensions"
+                amulet.raise_status(amulet.FAIL, msg=message)

So this problem was definitely there before this review was posted.'}, {'account_id': 25664, 'date': '2018-07-06 10:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Should the test be fixed in this patch or it should be done as a separate bug?'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-07-06 11:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think we should fix the test here while this is technically not a part of the review.

I may have time for this at the end of the next week but I am open to reviewing earlier if you have time to do it.'}, {'account_id': 25664, 'date': '2018-07-06 12:32:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ok, I will try to do it earlier.'}, {'account_id': 25664, 'date': '2018-07-09 20:16:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25664, 'date': '2018-07-10 06:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-07-10 06:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-29 17:59:13.000000000', 'message': "Clean up env files for Cinder's Netapp backend

Remove the misleading comment from the cinder-netapp-config.yaml file in
the environments directory that claimed the file is deprecated in favor
of the 'sample-env-generator' file in the environments/storage directory.
The sample-env-generator has not been widely adopted, and the Netapp
file in the environments directory is still being maintained.

Update the sample-env-generator files so they specify the
OS::TripleO::Services::CinderBackendNetApp composable service.

Closes-Bug: 1779397
Change-Id: If0343e96700bf13c0d49c3ae3c311ada1c26a0c0
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up env files for Cinder's Netapp backend

Remove the misleading comment from the cinder-netapp-config.yaml file in
the environments directory that claimed the file is deprecated in favor
of the 'sample-env-generator' file in the environments/storage directory.
The sample-env-generator has not been widely adopted, and the Netapp
file in the environments directory is still being maintained.

Update the sample-env-generator files so they specify the
OS::TripleO::Services::CinderBackendNetApp composable service.

Closes-Bug: 1779397
Change-Id: If0343e96700bf13c0d49c3ae3c311ada1c26a0c0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-15 15:31:57.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup the config file on ./clean.sh

When users unstack and clean on devstack, the old config files
should be removed to avoid potential issues. As a result, users
will get a fresh new install on the next ./stack.sh

Change-Id: I4c63ca1b6101a9f08bf9629b2bd7384b2198dac5
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup the config file on ./clean.sh

When users unstack and clean on devstack, the old config files
should be removed to avoid potential issues. As a result, users
will get a fresh new install on the next ./stack.sh

Change-Id: I4c63ca1b6101a9f08bf9629b2bd7384b2198dac5

The change [1] was wrong since it uses the wrong resource

commit_message:
Fix bug introduced by notify apache for aodh-api

The change [1] was wrong since it uses the wrong resource
name for the puppetlabs-apache Service defintion [2].

Instead of the revert this fixes it by changing it back to
the proper variable which has the value 'httpd'.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580618/
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/blob/master/manifests/service.pp#L43

Change-Id: If90241c5f0b74d1c72f222d40bd82e55ef6995c9

If you force logout of the session to the backend, you will also lose all other existing volumes attached to that host from that backend.  This seems very dangerous to do.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2015-08-28 01:30:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
iSCSI Connector: force disconnect iscsi session

When detaching a volume from Nova, Nova libvirt driver tries to
detach the virtual device from VM with libvirt detachDeviceFlags[1]
call, which is an async call, i.e. may not finish detaching the device
when it returns.  Currently iSCSI connector doesn't disconnect the
iSCSI session if the lun is still in use.  This change adds a 'force'
flag to disconnect_volume() call so that iSCSI connector users can
decide to log out iSCSI session even lun is still in use.  In Nova
libvirt driver case, when detachDeviceFlags() takes too long to
finish, Nova now has a chance to log out iSCSI sessions forcefully.

Note, this newly added 'force' flag doesn't work when multipath is enabled,
that shall be taken cared of in a separate patch.

Co-authored-by: Qiu Yu <qiuyu@ebaysf.com>

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1436561

[1] http://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainDetachDeviceFlags

Change-Id: I49b8dc69e0225329252836cd0f32bd6a214fe7cd

commit_message:
Use local connection and become for localhost plays

When targeting localhost with 'remote_user: root' and
using 'become: yes' we lose the environment variables
for the user running the playbook (eg: USER, HOME).

However, if we use 'connection: local' and 'become: yes'
together, it works properly.

To ensure these plays have the correct access to change
things on the host, we apply this change to them all.

We also ensure that 'become: no' is explicitly set on
any local connection plays to make the intent more
obvious. Finally, we also use 'yes' and 'no' uniformly.

Change-Id: I6e4607dd4aaffa0bfcda254103697bf9b28eca1a

commit_message:
Updates OpenDaylight healthcheck URI

The new URI is more accurate and only supported as of ODL version
Fluorine.

Closes-Bug: 1779215

Change-Id: I3e51820ec26afb1629e58500c469140a094ce2f7
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix multi region issue for software deployment

Except commit Iec6f3606c9fdf8474f393b0990356f34d38bcf75 we still
need this one to make sure the region name can be populated as
deployment metadata.

Task: 22854
Story: 2002781

commit_message:
Treat sphinx warnings as errors

This enables sphinx to treat warnings as errors. With this change any
documentation format errors will be flagged in the CI sphinx job.

Change-Id: Ia0cc5a264f2c1db222156b655b706bc581f8820c

commit_message:
Add more rabbitmq options

Adds the rabbit_ha_queues, rabbit_heartbeat_timeout_threshold
and rabbit_heartbeat_rate parameters that is used to configure
oslo messaging.

Change-Id: Iaf5679283e56f112b15d8440f57d708b525bb024
(cherry picked from commit c1a475e0c99272e33b4b599ca0b812042c686603)

commit_message:
Fix typo in magnum::clients classes

Using magnum::clietns instead of magnum::clients
for the default values causing it to not work.

Change-Id: Ie06d7ac340a00c1d249f5272e70d0244e4d74526
(cherry picked from commit 162203cd90c06230c2f458831319925c262fa3b2)

commit_message:
[DNM]Adding TripleO containerized undercloud tempest job

* tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers will install
  containerized undercloud using heat and then it will run tempest
  tests from heat-tempest-plugin.
* Since TripleO deployment is heavily driven by heat and having a job
  will help to catch the issues early in TripleO and making the heat
  and TripleO project better.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565642/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565657/
Change-Id: I1efdc160a0056f1c6e7901c2cc50e1f67565ebe2

commit_message:
PoC: reshaper guts with inventory two-step

Demonstrate an alternative approach to performing inventory +
allocation reshape. In this approach we first create a kind of "union"
inventory so we aren't trying to allocate to nonexistent inventories or
remove inventories with allocations. We then replace all allocations. We
then set the inventories to their final state.

This is for inspection/experimentation and, if likey, squashing into its
parent.

Change-Id: I4fd1dbdc0613e5c7c29cdacbed4a9b39e7573ab9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 17:34:28.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I245efae4ce7c72f6a31532c4ad0720d9892c801b
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I245efae4ce7c72f6a31532c4ad0720d9892c801b

commit_message:
Allow to disable printing expected runtime errors in SSHAuth

When users on a node are not prepared yet, it is expected
to get wrong authorization exception like this:

ssh_client.py:147 -- Connection using stored authentication info failed!
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
BadAuthenticationType: ('Bad authentication type', [u'publickey']) (allowed_types=[u'publickey'])

- new parameter to SSHClient 'verbose' allows to disable printing
  such errors during waiting for ssh access.

Change-Id: I665d5dca3c064e5445863870bfb97d12cf2a4905

[{'created': '2018-07-05 01:29:29.000000000', 'message': "Support cloning one freeze to multiple

The idea behind the version-map code is to work around a lack of a node
that has multiple python3 versions by taking a a freeze from one version
(say python-3.5) and cloning that to another (say python-3,4).  Thsi was
written to facilitate the transition from trusty (3.4) to xenial (3.5).

With the transition from xenial (3.5) to bionic (3.6) we need to do
something similar.  To aid the transition it'd be nice to be able to
duplicate a 3.5 freeze to both 3.4 *and* 3.6.  The current version_map
doesn't allow for that.

Enhance the version_map code to accommodate this situation.  The idea
would be to backport this as far as Ocata[1]

[1] We need to look again at separating the requirements code from the
data

Change-Id: I8784509bc162eb6f2e80261bc2d81dbe63ce7989

written to facilitate the transition from trusty (3.4) to xenial (3.5).

With the transition from xenial (3.5) to bionic (3.6) we need to do

Change-Id: I8784509bc162eb6f2e80261bc2d81dbe63ce7989
"}]
commit_message:
Support cloning one freeze to multiple

The idea behind the version-map code is to work around a lack of a node
that has multiple python3 versions by taking a freeze from one version
(say python-3.5) and cloning that to another (say python-3,4).  This was
written to facilitate the transition from trusty (3.4) to xenial (3.5).

With the transition from xenial (3.5) to bionic (3.6) we need to do
something similar.  To aid the transition it'd be nice to be able to
duplicate a 3.5 freeze to both 3.4 *and* 3.6.  The current version_map
doesn't allow for that.

Enhance the version_map code to accommodate this situation.  The idea
would be to backport this as far as Ocata[1]

[1] We need to look again at separating the requirements code from the
data

Change-Id: I8784509bc162eb6f2e80261bc2d81dbe63ce7989

I ran the tests locally and they pass ;-)'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-07-13 16:10:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 13:24:55.000000000', 'message': 'Suppress excessive debug logs when consume rabbit

If using rabbitmq as rpc backend, oslo.messaging generates large amount
of redundant timeout debug logs (several logs per second on multiple
openstack services, such as nova, heat, cinder), in format of 'Timed out
waiting for RPC response: Timeout while waiting on RPC response - topic:
"<unknown>", RPC method: "<unknown>" info: "<unknown>'. It's because
each socket timeout exception is raised to multiple levels of error
recovery callback functions then logged repeatedly.

However, the accompanying value of socket.timeout exception is currently
always “timed out”. Besides, oslo.messaging has implemented retry
mechanism to recover socket timeout failure. Therefore, IMO those logs
should be suppressed, even if at debug level, to save disk space and
make debugging more convenient.

Change-Id: Iafc360f8d18871cff93e7fd721d793ecdef5f4a1
Closes-Bug: #1714558
(cherry picked from commit 147186c7b4aabd2155f58f61913882f7a066bcbc)
'}]
commit_message:
Suppress excessive debug logs when consume rabbit

If using rabbitmq as rpc backend, oslo.messaging generates large amount
of redundant timeout debug logs (several logs per second on multiple
openstack services, such as nova, heat, cinder), in format of 'Timed out
waiting for RPC response: Timeout while waiting on RPC response - topic:
"<unknown>", RPC method: "<unknown>" info: "<unknown>'. It's because
each socket timeout exception is raised to multiple levels of error
recovery callback functions then logged repeatedly.

However, the accompanying value of socket.timeout exception is currently
always “timed out”. Besides, oslo.messaging has implemented retry
mechanism to recover socket timeout failure. Therefore, IMO those logs
should be suppressed, even if at debug level, to save disk space and
make debugging more convenient.

Change-Id: Iafc360f8d18871cff93e7fd721d793ecdef5f4a1
Closes-Bug: #1714558
(cherry picked from commit 147186c7b4aabd2155f58f61913882f7a066bcbc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 20:57:55.000000000', 'message': 'do not assume 1 consumer in AllocList.delete_all()

Ever since we introduced support for setting multiple consumers in a
single POST /allocations, the AllocationList.delete_all() method has
been housing a latent bad assumption and bug.

The AllocationList.delete_all() method used to assume that the
AllocationList's Allocation objects were only ever for a single
consumer, and took a shortcut in deleting the allocation by deleting all
allocations with the "first" Allocation's consumer UUID:

```python
    def delete_all(self):
        # Allocations can only have a single consumer, so take advantage of
        # that fact and do an efficient batch delete
        consumer_uuid = self.objects[0].consumer.uuid
        _delete_allocations_for_consumer(self._context, consumer_uuid)
        consumer_obj.delete_consumers_if_no_allocations(
            self._context, [consumer_uuid])
```

The problem with the above is that if you get all the allocations for a
single resource provider, using
AllocationList.get_all_by_resource_provider() and there are more than
one consumer allocating resources against that provider, then calling
AllocationList.delete_all() will only delete *some* of the resource
provider's allocations, not all of them.

Luckily, the handler code has never used AllocationList.delete_all()
after calling AllocationList.get_all_by_resource_provider(), and so
we've not hit this latent bug in production.

However, in the next patch in this series (the reshaper DB work), we
*do* call AllocationList.delete_all() for allocation lists for each
provider involved in the reshape operation, which is why this fix is
important to get done correctly.

Note that this patch renames AllocationList.create_all() to
AllocationList.replace_all() to make it absolutely clear that all of
the allocations for all consumers in the list are first *deleted* by the
codebase and then re-created. We also remove the check in
AllocationList.create_all() that the Allocation objects in the list must
not have an 'id' field set. The reason for that is because in order to
properly implement AllocationList.delete_all() to call DELETE FROM
allocations WHERE id IN (<...>) we need the list of allocation record
internal IDs. These id field values are now properly set on the
Allocation objects when AllocationList.get_all_by_resource_provider()
and AllocationList.get_all_by_consumer_id() are called. This allows that
returned object to have delete_all() called on it and the DELETE
statement to work properly.

Change-Id: I12393b033054683bcc3e6f20da14e6243b4d5577
Closes-bug: #1781430
'}]
commit_message:
do not assume 1 consumer in AllocList.delete_all()

Ever since we introduced support for setting multiple consumers in a
single POST /allocations, the AllocationList.delete_all() method has
been housing a latent bad assumption and bug.

The AllocationList.delete_all() method used to assume that the
AllocationList's Allocation objects were only ever for a single
consumer, and took a shortcut in deleting the allocation by deleting all
allocations with the "first" Allocation's consumer UUID:

```python
    def delete_all(self):
        # Allocations can only have a single consumer, so take advantage of
        # that fact and do an efficient batch delete
        consumer_uuid = self.objects[0].consumer.uuid
        _delete_allocations_for_consumer(self._context, consumer_uuid)
        consumer_obj.delete_consumers_if_no_allocations(
            self._context, [consumer_uuid])
```

The problem with the above is that if you get all the allocations for a
single resource provider, using
AllocationList.get_all_by_resource_provider() and there are more than
one consumer allocating resources against that provider, then calling
AllocationList.delete_all() will only delete *some* of the resource
provider's allocations, not all of them.

Luckily, the handler code has never used AllocationList.delete_all()
after calling AllocationList.get_all_by_resource_provider(), and so
we've not hit this latent bug in production.

However, in the next patch in this series (the reshaper DB work), we
*do* call AllocationList.delete_all() for allocation lists for each
provider involved in the reshape operation, which is why this fix is
important to get done correctly.

Note that this patch renames AllocationList.create_all() to
AllocationList.replace_all() to make it absolutely clear that all of
the allocations for all consumers in the list are first *deleted* by the
codebase and then re-created. We also remove the check in
AllocationList.create_all() that the Allocation objects in the list must
not have an 'id' field set. The reason for that is because in order to
properly implement AllocationList.delete_all() to call DELETE FROM
allocations WHERE id IN (<...>) we need the list of allocation record
internal IDs. These id field values are now properly set on the
Allocation objects when AllocationList.get_all_by_resource_provider()
and AllocationList.get_all_by_consumer_id() are called. This allows that
returned object to have delete_all() called on it and the DELETE
statement to work properly.

Change-Id: I12393b033054683bcc3e6f20da14e6243b4d5577
Closes-bug: #1781430

brings the following changes in response body of POST, GET
``/os-server-groups`` API and GET
``/os-server-groups/{server_group_id}`` API:

* Add new format ``policy`` filed, which is a dictionary
representation of a server group policy containing the fields
``name``, ``rules``.
* Remove ``policies`` and ``metadata`` fields.

Part of blueprint: complex-anti-affinity-policies

commit_message:
Microversion 2.64 - Use new format policy in server group

Enable users to define the policy rules on server group policy
to meet more advanced policy requirement. This microversion
brings the following changes in server group APIs:

* Add  ``policy`` and ``rules`` fields in the request of POST
  ``/os-server-groups``.
* The ``policy`` and ``rules`` fields will be
  returned in response body of POST, GET ``/os-server-groups``
  API and GET ``/os-server-groups/{server_group_id}`` API.
* The ``policies`` and ``metadata`` fields have been removed
  from the response body of POST, GET ``/os-server-groups`` API
  and GET ``/os-server-groups/{server_group_id}`` API.

Part of blueprint: complex-anti-affinity-policies

Change-Id: I6911e97bd7f8df92511e90518dba21c127e106a5

commit_message:
devstack: Set and clean iptables

We were only setting API LB member iptables in gates. This patch makes
them available in development devstack scenarios and adds cleanup of
kuryr devstack set iptables.

Change-Id: I8ebfe20aabd8d94062490063325806cee0d08436
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <asegurap@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Network Custom Resource Definition De-facto Standard support

The purpose of Kubernetes Network Custom Resource Definition De-facto
Standard spec defined by Network Plumbing Working Group, is trying to
standardize the multi-network effort around K8S. In that spec, It
defines a PoD annotation and CRD mechanism for attaching pods to
multiple networks, using various CNIs.

This proposal is based on VIF-Handler And Vif Drivers Design. A new VIF
driver is created, which can parse the PoD annotation and CRD defined
by NPWG spec, and return the vif objects to Multi-vif driver.

Partially Implements: blueprint kuryr-npwg-spec-support
Change-Id: I4402b9b8f04536b31f14684559c2aad86bd54162

commit_message:
Sync up Flask version with global-requirements

As Flask version was updated we need to update our own requirements.txt
to avoid reqirements-check job to fail on every patch that changes
anything related to requirements.

Hopefully that's the last issue introduced by Flask upgrade.

Change-Id: Ief90d241104fe2d42b3c9504a827ea640c304a7a

individual drivers do not need to repeat that.

Add choices with descriptions when emitting samples. We don't really

the config generator and documentation.

set instead of just a group name when describing the options.

commit_message:
add detail to driver options in config generator

Have the main _list_opts caller construct the driver option so
individual drivers do not need to repeat that.

Add choices with descriptions when emitting samples. We don't really
care about those for the runtime use, but they improve the output in
the config generator and documentation.

Use an OptGroup with the driver_option and dynamic_group_owner options
set instead of just a group name when describing the options.

Add sample_default values for some of the options in the URI driver.

Change-Id: I14c0a046e6c70a9108308db70a4efb70613d5bb3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

"}, {'created': '2018-07-10 15:47:51.000000000', 'message': "Use crm_diff for pcmk resource deep_compare

Detect if crm_diff is fixed and if it is favour the crm_diff resource
comparison. Also introduce a 'update_settle_timeout' parameter
for resources that can be used to override the amount of time (s)
to wait for the cluster to settle after updating a resource.

Also for resources we simply will call 'pcs resource update' instead
of deleting and readding the resource offline and then pushing the CIB.
We cannot do that yet with bundles due to RHBZ#1598197

Tested this as follows:
1) Normal deploys work fine (the code never gets triggered anyway)
2) Redeploy with no changes -> pcmk resources are untouched
   (the code does not get triggered anyway)
3) Redeploy by adding the following hiera keys:
   ExtraConfig:
     pacemaker::resource::bundle::deep_compare: true
     pacemaker::resource::ip::deep_compare: true
     pacemaker::resource::ocf::deep_compare: true
   -> pcmk resources are untouched
4) Redeploy with keys at 3) but with changes that trigger a restart
   -> pcmk resources are restarted and cluster waits for the
      restart before continuing

Change-Id: I62d5662327333e17e1c32a029695b3d3a904ca10
"}, {'created': '2018-07-10 16:00:37.000000000', 'message': "Use crm_diff for pcmk resource deep_compare

commit_message:
Use crm_diff for pcmk resource deep_compare

Detect if crm_diff is fixed and if it is favour the crm_diff resource
comparison. Also introduce a 'update_settle_secs' parameter
for resources that can be used to override the amount of time (s)
to wait for the cluster to settle after updating a resource.

Tested this as follows:
1) Normal deploys work fine (the code never gets triggered anyway)
2) Redeploy with no changes -> pcmk resources are untouched
   (the code does not get triggered anyway)
3) Redeploy by adding the following hiera keys:
   ExtraConfig:
     pacemaker::resource::bundle::deep_compare: true
     pacemaker::resource::ip::deep_compare: true
     pacemaker::resource::ocf::deep_compare: true
   -> pcmk resources are untouched
4) Redeploy with keys at 3) but with changes that trigger a restart
   -> pcmk resources are restarted and cluster waits for the
      restart before continuing

Change-Id: I62d5662327333e17e1c32a029695b3d3a904ca10

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 21:44:32.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Change-Id: I8f193d5f6f1f6020b23a4c4eebf3ad537d61e0b7
"}, {'created': '2018-07-04 12:55:13.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580156
Change-Id: I8f193d5f6f1f6020b23a4c4eebf3ad537d61e0b7

commit_message:
Introduce a function to verify for fixed crm_diff

We currently use crm_simulate to understand if a resource needs
an update in the CIB. This is less than ideal, but we had to do
so due to rhbz#1561617. Now that this BZ is fixed we will be
able to use crm_diff to compare CIBs. In order to stay backwards
compatible we need to understand if we have a fixed crm_diff or not.
So we can use the crm_diff method only when a fixed crm_diff binary
is present.

Tested this on an older, broken crm_diff:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 cibs]# crm_diff --cib --original-string='..xml1..' --new-string='..xml2..'
<diff format="2" digest="d86aa7f248182e125820c743bcb6118d">
  <version>
    <source admin_epoch="0" epoch="86" num_updates="125"/>
    <target admin_epoch="0" epoch="86" num_updates="125"/>
  </version>
  <change operation="modify" path="/cib/configuration/resources/bundle[@id='galera-bundle']/storage/storage-mapping[@id='mysql-foo']">
    <change-list>
      <change-attr name="id" operation="set" value="mysql-foo"/>
      <change-attr name="target-dir" operation="set" value="/foo"/>
    </change-list>
    <change-result>
      <storage-mapping id="mysql-foo" options="rw" source-dir="/foo" target-dir="/foo"/>
    </change-result>
  </change>
  <change operation="modify" path="/cib/configuration/resources/bundle[@id='galera-bundle']/storage/storage-mapping[@id='mysql-bar']">
    <change-list>
      <change-attr name="id" operation="set" value="mysql-bar"/>
      <change-attr name="target-dir" operation="set" value="/bar"/>
    </change-list>
    <change-result>
      <storage-mapping id="mysql-bar" options="rw" source-dir="/bar" target-dir="/bar"/>
    </change-result>
  </change>
</diff>
[root@overcloud-controller-0 cibs]# echo $?
1

On a fixed crm_diff:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 cibs]# crm_diff --cib --original-string='..xml1..' --new-string='..xml2..'
[root@overcloud-controller-0 cibs]# echo $?
0

Change-Id: I888b9ae54b8e639a2dbffb1744aa27edae4a4a57

commit_message:
Resource_provider API handler does not return specific error codes

There are a few places in the resource_provider.py placement
API handler module that need to be updated to return custom
error codes.

Change-Id: I7efdf7f82d581cf5dc9a3decc063b69c8cef22ff
Closes-Bug: #1778929

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 14:54:18.000000000', 'message': "[Fullstack] HA L3 agent restart only standby agents

In fullstack test which is testing if there is no packet lost
during restart of agents there were restarted always all agents
which hosted router.
In case when as first was restarted 'master' agent it might
lead to the case when after restart 'master' node was switched
to second L3 agent and that caused lost of few packets and
failed test.
This test should only check if restart of standby agents will
not cause any packet lost so this patch do it in this way.

Change-Id: I6293169d7d7f35e3a9726071e63003ac569dd01e
Closes-Bug: #1776459
(cherry picked from commit c57a5d9d8aef4a9b89e3d41c293ceb40d7ebad22)

commit_message:
[Fullstack] HA L3 agent restart only standby agents

In fullstack test which is testing if there is no packet lost
during restart of agents there were restarted always all agents
which hosted router.
In case when as first was restarted 'master' agent it might
lead to the case when after restart 'master' node was switched
to second L3 agent and that caused lost of few packets and
failed test.
This test should only check if restart of standby agents will
not cause any packet lost so this patch do it in this way.

Change-Id: I6293169d7d7f35e3a9726071e63003ac569dd01e
Closes-Bug: #1776459
(cherry picked from commit c57a5d9d8aef4a9b89e3d41c293ceb40d7ebad22)

commit_message:
Backport tox.ini to switch to stestr

The pike branch was still using ostestr (instead of stestr) which makes
running tests significantly different from queens or master. To make
things behave the same way this commit backports most of the tox.ini
from queens so that pike will behave the same way for running tests.
This does not use the standard backport mechanism because it involves a
lot of different commits over time. It's also not a functional change
for nova itself, so the proper procedure is less important here.

Change-Id: Ie207afaf8defabc1d1eb9332f43a9753a00f784d

commit_message:
Support node's deploy_step field

Adds support for a node's ``deploy_step`` (read-only) field.
The deploy step indicates which step is being performed
during the deployment/provisioning of a node.
It is available starting with Bare Metal API version 1.44.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579968/
Change-Id: I93ac628bca0822a9a359926389543f7db7fb3e56
Story: #1753128
Task: #22925

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is maintained project
to which all Openstack projects should migrate.

Let's switch it then.

Also adjust requirements to pass the gate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I79b2220c20a04e2e33360bc330b5b4b4124caf71
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove testrepository and .testr.conf

This commit is a follow-up of "switch to using stestr"
which was merged already [1].
After switch to using stestr, testrepository and .testr.conf
are unnecessary and should be removed.

This patch also switch from "test" to "stestr" for coverage job .

[1] https://review.openstack.org/571716

Change-Id: I6b506a19edf06a5bc40472f84a51eaae98583a62

commit_message:
hardware: fix hugepages memory usage per intances

In the algo to compute memory, when several instances are their memory
backed on a same host NUMA node, we always compute the memory used
based on the initial 'used' value of hostcell.

Partial-Bug: #1594529
Change-Id: I5b8684b10688b91ca36a509ea0cb8bee397263d6
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit b1c45fedc3b80769f21ffe5ff748593a4b017a7a)

commit_message:
Add utility function for datastore clusters

Add new function which returns reference and name of the specified
datastore cluster. The cluster can be specified either by name or by its
moid.

Change-Id: I73df95294accc1954da571437efc8302edf544d2

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib8493a9a2ec30cafa70a67a6f5fd1fee29432ad7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 14:02:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for cells v2,

This change adds relations necessary for registering a compute cell
with the superconductor. For a cell to be registered this charm
must have relations with the compute cells conductor, database and
message queue. Only when all these relations are complete can the
registration happen. Below are major changes included in this PR.

* Add nova-cell-api relation for communicating with the
  nova-cell-conductor
* Add shared-db-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells database.
* Add amqp-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells message queue.
* Add methods for registering ceells with the
  superconductors database.
* Charm helper sync

Change-Id: I54f98c1d420b6a6b1dd8ed7dbd00a2362b584b81
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for cells v2,

This change adds relations necessary for registering a compute cell
with the superconductor. For a cell to be registered this charm
must have relations with the compute cells conductor, database and
message queue. Only when all these relations are complete can the
registration happen. Below are major changes included in this PR.

* Add nova-cell-api relation for communicating with the
  nova-cell-conductor
* Add shared-db-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells database.
* Add amqp-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells message queue.
* Add methods for registering ceells with the
  superconductors database.
* Charm helper sync

Change-Id: I54f98c1d420b6a6b1dd8ed7dbd00a2362b584b81

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic7138594becaf7061d8b4d0d3fe9bf243fef35af
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-06-13 18:59:14.000000000', 'message': 'update pylint to 1.9.2

The older version of pylint being used does not work correctly under
python 3. In order to be able to update the pylint job to run under
python 3, we need to update the tool.

This patch updates to the latest version at this time. It also updates
and pins astroid, which was previously capped. Using a pin instead of
a cap should let us avoid issues with new releases while being
specific about which version to actually use.

Change-Id: I6443247ab110dc9d5e71d23dc40ceabb439e23be
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
update pylint to 1.9.2

The older version of pylint being used does not work correctly under
python 3. In order to be able to update the pylint job to run under
python 3, we need to update the tool.

This patch updates to the latest version at this time. It also updates
and pins astroid, which was previously capped. Using a pin instead of
a cap should let us avoid issues with new releases while being
specific about which version to actually use.

This patch also fix lower-constraints.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6443247ab110dc9d5e71d23dc40ceabb439e23be
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-07-03 18:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-07-03 18:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-03 19:02:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

do you have initial content to import?'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-07-03 20:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> do you have initial content to import?

I do not.  There will be an accompanying tripleo-heat-templates change that will Depend-On each change that populates these repos, so it will be ideal if everything can be ready in gerrit before we start moving things around.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-04 11:02:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So, how do you plan to populate the repos?'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-07-06 17:26:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> So, how do you plan to populate the repos?

Via gerrit reviews.
I can create some skeleton repos if that's needed."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-06 18:33:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Seems I'm a bit confused by your comments. So, these are complete empty repos that you have no prior content to import - but still want to create them with a dependency on existing repos? I miss something...

I'm fine merging as is - but this first needs PTL + 1 and I like PTL to confirm how the repos are set up. Once both are done, I'll +2."}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-07-06 18:59:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Seems I'm a bit confused by your comments. So, these are complete
 > empty repos that you have no prior content to import - but still
 > want to create them with a dependency on existing repos? I miss
 > something...
 > 
 > I'm fine merging as is - but this first needs PTL + 1 and I like
 > PTL to confirm how the repos are set up. Once both are done, I'll
 > +2.

Oh, sorry - there's no content in them yet because when the content gets created, it will also be removed from another repo.  We'll be migrating ansible tasks that are inlined in heat templates now and putting it into these repos.  So those patches to add tasks to, for example, ansible-role-tripleo-cinder will have corresponding patches in the appropriate t-h-t cinder heat template file to remove the tasks.  I can totally make some skeleton role repos though, with just an empty tasks/main.yml, vars/main.yml, etc."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-06 19:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-06 20:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jill, no need to make empty repos. My initial assumption was that you move code as-is from one existing repo to new repo - and that is something you can easily do.

But if you have to change the code and thus losing history is no problem, you can as well start from scratch with an empty repo.

What I want to avoid is that you come in a week with 10+ patches to a new repo to import content with history (which would produce a high load on our systems) - or ask to import a repo at one point (which is a manual task and needs work).

So, to be clear: An empty repo is fine - the comments you made earlier let me - I fear now wrongly - believe you that you had content.'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-07-06 20:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-07-06 22:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-12 18:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-12 19:00:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-12 19:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-07-16 13:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Adding Ansible roles for TripleO

Based on the newly introduced design of per-repository Ansible
roles for TripleO component management, this change adds the
bulk of repos needed for TripleO Ansible tooling.

Related to: Ic016538588afdb1d483ab892a1d4b17fc77b5dd4

Change-Id: Ib02f9ef8fc9172c65851c1fa30ad51114a4c7e0e
Needed-By: Ie8aea149d97b77bdfd8455d3e36e97bb47510afc
blueprint: ansible-tasks-to-role

commit_message:
Add OpenStack operations Ansible role

This Ansible role handles tasks related to operating an OpenStack cloud
deployed with TripleO. It contains tasks for cleaning up Docker, restarting
services, and fetching log files.

Change-Id: Id92ad1a43f3e2c5947a49f17e7c1cf9e3f3fefc4

commit_message:
Revert "Adds docker SFC and cleans up ODL envs"

This reverts commit baec8bba6fc347052e737524683d14db5dafd26b.
We need to double-check it does not break compatibility by removing
containerized services leaving only its BM alternatives.
Specifically, openstack/tripleo-heat-templates /
environments/neutron-sfc-opendaylight.yaml cannot be just removed
w/o deprecation.

Change-Id: Id88b3141284311ce56cdd45a58d257e92bd6e621

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 20:21:11.000000000', 'message': 'update the pti to use tox for building docs and releasenotes

As part of planning out the python3 transition we realized that in
order to have a self-testing patch in each repository to switch the
documentation and release notes builds to use python3, we would need
to include some information in the repository that the job would read
to decide which version of python to use. After considering several
options, we realized that this requirement meant we had set the API
for the documentation and release notes jobs at the wrong "level" of
the stack.

This patch restores the use of tox for building documentation and
release notes in the standard project testing interface. Rather than
using the "venv" environment, it specifies new environments for "docs"
and "releasenotes" based on the common pattern we have in most
projects to provide those as a convenience for developers.

The Python-specific notes about adding those environments as a
convenience are removed, since those environments are now required.

Change-Id: Ibdee118f30972e9dc67952b921f493e9c1a116ff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-07-05 20:34:13.000000000', 'message': 'update the pti to use tox for building docs

commit_message:
update the pti to use tox for building docs

As part of planning out the python3 transition we realized that in
order to have a self-testing patch in each repository to switch the
documentation build to use python3, we would need to include some
information in the repository that the job would read to decide which
version of python to use. After considering several options, we
realized that this requirement meant we had set the API for the
documentation jobs at the wrong "level" of the stack.

This patch restores the use of tox for building documentation in the
standard project testing interface. Rather than using the "venv"
environment, it specifies a new environment for "docs", based on the
common pattern we have in most projects to provide that as a
convenience for developers.

The Python-specific notes about adding the environment as a
convenience are removed, since it is now required.

Change-Id: Ibdee118f30972e9dc67952b921f493e9c1a116ff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add check_review_status.py

I have been using this script to apply the house rules to governance
changes to help track when they are ready to be approved. I thought it
would be good to share it for others to be able to see and review the
work.

Change-Id: I41e3338858f546705e78ce5428a09dfe3b904947
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
use tempest_format to pkg for non containerized undercloud

* Since tempest container is shipped with containerized undercloud
  and above jobs does not have containerized UC and if tempest_format
  is switched to container, it will pull tempest docker images
  from dockerhub which does contains latest packages which leads
  to testing older commits and which in return we are able to late
  find out the issues caused by tempest and python-tempestconf.

Change-Id: Ie38c7be6f6fe49fe976866c2d8b474d7910171d7

commit_message:
Disable keepalived ping tests by default

At the moment, the keepalived ping tests are something that is
configured by default which is ideal because it's hardcoded with
a public IP address that might result in a failing deployment
if the environment does not for some reason reach it.

We should leave the option to be there however not have all default
deployments hitting this IP as it can introduce behaviour where
if that IP fails, every single OpenStack Ansible deployment would
fail afterwards.

Closes-Bug: #1672453
Change-Id: I5aec4664e67fb2b3e1c0a2fc9782a4ccaa78a39a

commit_message:
Run Docker container without the controller service

This adds the option to run the Docker container without the controller
service running on the container.
This is useful in order to create separation between the Dragonflow
API (df-db) and the controller service.

Related-Bug: #1778007

Change-Id: I4fb77ae03e47942a75d34bfb4f8c80db21a3aec6

commit_message:
Fix KeyError if a deprecated key is given

It happens when a deprecated key is given(i.e. os-auth-ver). The service shall
change the reference before calling oslo.config.

Change-Id: I841f027f90e353b7ea5e1ec059286e8fa9b94f49
Closes-Bug: #1774722
(cherry picked from commit c1499e54cdb06dab5e54686035bf56a537208d61)

commit_message:
Adds docker SFC and cleans up ODL envs

There are now duplicate places where environment files for deployments
are kept.  Those include environments/ and environments/services.  The
files in environments/ are incorrect and should be removed to leave only
a single place (environments/services) to store docker services.
environments/services-baremetal house the legacy bm services.

This patch also adds a missing docker service for SFC so that we can
also include an ODL SFC docker env file.

Change-Id: If70818db9577b7d80c4acd0d0577d9432b5c8bef
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-07-03 09:41:12.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I574364f9b072387883bedfc7404072642041f380

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I574364f9b072387883bedfc7404072642041f380

commit_message:
Dockerfile: Create neutron configurations

If the Neutron configuration files does not exist in the
docker image, use Dragonflow's configuration files as neutron's
configuration files.

Related-Bug: #1778007

Change-Id: I167a290358427bd94dba9c6db6f02a153b5ca734

commit_message:
Add conductor_group field to nodes and conductors tables

Adds the field to both tables as a VARCHAR(255), non-nullable, with a
default of "".

Change-Id: Iba812dd959094d73034c20345d005f8613a17b1b
Story: 2001795
Task: 22639

Consider using that mode, when implemented."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-04 11:14:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-04 11:17:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-04 11:20:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Enable loadbalancer for kubernetes masters

This uses our existing HAProxy and vip management to route requests
to the kubernetes API services on each master.

See also other HA/LB options explained:

https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/kubespray/pull/2126

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If53e9c194f540fe67a893217d76bf3e35523b5d7

commit_message:
Remove unused TimingSession class

TimingSession is removed and replaced by keystone session (see [1]).
This patch remove it from monasca client.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579139/

Change-Id: I4bfcef96bcb9c8fd14e2c57f318630aa508710ca
Story: #2002978
Task: #22987

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 10:23:51.000000000', 'message': "network: Add 'populate_networks' to network API

This provides a generic way to fully populate the RequestedNetwork
objects created at boot time. This mostly reuses and replaces the code
from the existing 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports' with the
following functional changes:

- physnet information is always retrieved if available, rather than just
  for SR-IOV ports, and is used to populate the 'physnet' attribute.
- The network ID is now retrieved if only a port ID is provided and is
  used to populate the 'network_id' attribute.

We don't add tests for the new function because we'll get them for free
in an upcoming patch that removes 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports'.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I3dde6074d69e299f2844675ef968c8f949722395
"}, {'created': '2018-05-07 15:44:53.000000000', 'message': "network: Add 'populate_networks' to network API

This provides a generic way to fully populate the RequestedNetwork
objects created at boot time. This mostly reuses and replaces the code
from the existing 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports' with the
following functional changes:

- physnet information is always retrieved if available, rather than just
  for SR-IOV ports, and is used to populate the 'physnet' attribute.
- The network ID is now retrieved if only a port ID is provided and is
  used to populate the 'network_id' attribute.

We don't add tests for the new function because we'll get them for free
in an upcoming patch that removes 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports'.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I3dde6074d69e299f2844675ef968c8f949722395
"}, {'created': '2018-05-10 13:43:54.000000000', 'message': "network: Add 'populate_networks' to network API

This provides a generic way to fully populate the RequestedNetwork
objects created at boot time. This mostly reuses and replaces the code
from the existing 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports' with the
following functional changes:

- physnet information is almost always retrieved if available, rather
  than just for SR-IOV ports, and is used to populate the 'physnet'
  attribute. The only exception to this is auto-allocated networks.
- The network ID is now retrieved if only a port ID is provided and is
  used to populate the 'network_id' attribute.

We don't add tests for the new function because we'll get them for free
in an upcoming patch that removes 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports'.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I3dde6074d69e299f2844675ef968c8f949722395
"}, {'created': '2018-06-08 13:30:05.000000000', 'message': "network: Add 'create_resource_requests' to network API

This provides a generic way to get all resources required due to the
requested networks. This mostly reuses and replaces the code from the
existing 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports' with the following
functional changes:

- Both functions now return an instance of 'InstanceNUMANetworkInfo',
  which is populated with additional metadata about the requested
  networks
- physnet information is almost always retrieved if available, rather
  than just for SR-IOV ports, and is used to populate the 'physnet'
  attribute of the returned 'InstanceNUMANetworkInfo' instance. The only
  exception to this is auto-allocated networks.
- The network ID is now retrieved if only a port ID is provided and is
  used to populate the 'network_id' attribute.

The 'tunnel' attribute of the 'InstanceNUMANetworkInfo' object is not
currently set in this function and will be addressed separately. This is
not an issue as the value returned from this function is not yet used.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches
